post.summary: Add a pending rate change for the specified note
post.description: Category 1 API - This method is used to create a pending rate change transaction for the specified note.

parameters.name: organization-id
parameters.description: FIS processing organization ID

parameters.name: source-id
parameters.description: Source Id

parameters.name: application-id
parameters.description: Application Id

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Unique request identifier

parameters.name: security-token-type
parameters.description: Security Token Type

parameters.name: saf-indicator
parameters.description:
SaF Indicator - Indicates if this service should be considered for store and forward processing.
Y - This request should be considered.
N - This request should not be considered.

parameters.name: IBS-Authorization
parameters.description: IBS-Authorization is required if Client Certificate is not passed

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-sk
parameters.description: A base64-encoded AES 128 or 256 bit key that is used to encrypt the data items within the ReST message.

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-x5ts256
parameters.description: (X.509 certificate SHA-256 thumbprint) - A base64-encoded SHA-256 thumbprint (a.k.a. digest) of the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate [RFC5280] corresponding to the public key used to encrypt information within this message.

parameters.name: EffectiveUserId
parameters.description: For applications using a System ID to log in to FIS, this field can be used to specify the RACF user ID of the bank employee executing the API. When supplied, the Effective User ID is used to authorize, execute, and log the host transaction.

parameters.name: AcctNbr
parameters.description:
Loan System account number. 
Length: 11
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30051

parameters.name: NoteNbr
parameters.description:
Note number.  If account-level rate change, enter zeros. 
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30054

parameters.name: RelDte
parameters.description:
Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37419

parameters.name: SeqNbr
parameters.description:
Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37420

parameters.name: accounts-notes-rate-changes-pending-post-Entity
parameters.description: accounts-notes-rate-changes-pending-post-Entity

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information about a pending rate change for the specified note
get.description: Category 1 API - This method is used to inquire on a pending rate change transaction for the specified note.

parameters.name: organization-id
parameters.description: FIS processing organization ID

parameters.name: source-id
parameters.description: Source Id

parameters.name: application-id
parameters.description: Application Id

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Unique request identifier

parameters.name: security-token-type
parameters.description: Security Token Type

parameters.name: IBS-Authorization
parameters.description: IBS-Authorization is required if Client Certificate is not passed

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-sk
parameters.description: A base64-encoded AES 128 or 256 bit key that is used to encrypt the data items within the ReST message.

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-x5ts256
parameters.description: (X.509 certificate SHA-256 thumbprint) - A base64-encoded SHA-256 thumbprint (a.k.a. digest) of the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate [RFC5280] corresponding to the public key used to encrypt information within this message.

parameters.name: EffectiveUserId
parameters.description: For applications using a System ID to log in to FIS, this field can be used to specify the RACF user ID of the bank employee executing the API. When supplied, the Effective User ID is used to authorize, execute, and log the host transaction.

parameters.name: AcctNbr
parameters.description:
Loan System account number. 
Length: 11
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30051

parameters.name: NoteNbr
parameters.description:
Note number.  If account-level rate change, enter zeros. 
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30054

parameters.name: EffDte
parameters.description:
Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37403

parameters.name: RtePln
parameters.description:
Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered. 
Length: 7
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37449

parameters.name: RateOver
parameters.description:
For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37404

parameters.name: RateOverMargin
parameters.description:
For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37405

parameters.name: RateOverRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37406

parameters.name: RateUnder
parameters.description:
For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37408

parameters.name: RateUnderMargin
parameters.description:
For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37409

parameters.name: RateUnderRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %). 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37410

parameters.name: Index
parameters.description:
Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37413

parameters.name: SplitLimitAmt
parameters.description:
Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 37414

parameters.name: Basis
parameters.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37415

parameters.name: PricePlan
parameters.description:
Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37417

parameters.name: RateCap
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37812

parameters.name: NxtRteChgDte
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37814

parameters.name: RteChgFreq
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37813

parameters.name: RelDte
parameters.description:
Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37419

parameters.name: SeqNbr
parameters.description:
Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37420

post.description: Category 1 API - This method is used to add a payment schedule to a note.  The service is not valid for Bill Type F floor plan notes.  There cannot be more than 13 active (current or future) schedules or more than 99 schedules total.  However, if coupons are used, you may only have a total of 12 schedules (active or inactive). get.summary: Retrieve total account level balances and individual note balances
get.description:
Category 1 API - This method retrieves the principal balance of all notes (excluding those with a zero balance), participations, and the total bank share (notes minus participations) as of any past date or the current date.  Totals are provided for the note balances, participation balances, and total account owing (the bank share).   

 You can limit the data to a particular loan category through use of the Inquiry Search Field 2.  You can also limit the data to TLC or OBP loans through use of the Inquiry Search Field 3.

get.description: Category 1 API - This method is used to inquire on a pending rate change transaction for the specified participation.

parameters.name: organization-id
parameters.description: FIS processing organization ID

parameters.name: source-id
parameters.description: Source Id

parameters.name: application-id
parameters.description: Application Id

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Unique request identifier

parameters.name: security-token-type
parameters.description: Security Token Type

parameters.name: IBS-Authorization
parameters.description: IBS-Authorization is required if Client Certificate is not passed

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-sk
parameters.description: A base64-encoded AES 128 or 256 bit key that is used to encrypt the data items within the ReST message.

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-x5ts256
parameters.description: (X.509 certificate SHA-256 thumbprint) - A base64-encoded SHA-256 thumbprint (a.k.a. digest) of the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate [RFC5280] corresponding to the public key used to encrypt information within this message.

parameters.name: EffectiveUserId
parameters.description: For applications using a System ID to log in to FIS, this field can be used to specify the RACF user ID of the bank employee executing the API. When supplied, the Effective User ID is used to authorize, execute, and log the host transaction.

parameters.name: AcctNbr
parameters.description:
Loan System account number. 
Length: 11
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30051

parameters.name: NoteNbr
parameters.description:
Note number.  If account-level rate change, enter zeros. 
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30054

parameters.name: PartNbr
parameters.description:
If rate change is to a participation sold, enter the participating bank number. 
Length: 11
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30074

parameters.name: PartSeq
parameters.description:
Participation sequence number.  If rate change is to a participation sold, the sequence number of the participation. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30075

parameters.name: EffDte
parameters.description:
Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37403

parameters.name: RtePln
parameters.description:
Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered. 
Length: 7
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37449

parameters.name: RateOver
parameters.description:
For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37404

parameters.name: RateOverMargin
parameters.description:
For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37405

parameters.name: RateOverRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37406

parameters.name: RateUnder
parameters.description:
For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37408

parameters.name: RateUnderMargin
parameters.description:
For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37409

parameters.name: RateUnderRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %). 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37410

parameters.name: Index
parameters.description:
Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37413

parameters.name: SplitLimitAmt
parameters.description:
Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 37414

parameters.name: Basis
parameters.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37415

parameters.name: PricePlan
parameters.description:
Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37417

parameters.name: RateCap
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37812

parameters.name: NxtRteChgDte
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37814

parameters.name: RteChgFreq
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37813

parameters.name: RelDte
parameters.description:
Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37419

parameters.name: SeqNbr
parameters.description:
Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37420

parameters.name: RateOver
parameters.description:
For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37404

parameters.name: RateOverMargin
parameters.description:
For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37405

parameters.name: RateOverRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37406

parameters.name: RateUnder
parameters.description:
For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37408

parameters.name: RateUnderMargin
parameters.description:
For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37409

parameters.name: RateUnderRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %). 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37410

parameters.name: Index
parameters.description:
Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37413

parameters.name: SplitLimitAmt
parameters.description:
Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 37414

parameters.name: Basis
parameters.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37415

parameters.name: LNCategory
parameters.description:
Identifies the loan category for account-level rate changes (Rate Indicator is A).  Rate change will be applied only to notes of this category.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 R  Revolving credit.  
 S  Specific accounts receivable. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37416

parameters.name: PricePlan
parameters.description:
Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37417

parameters.name: RateCap
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37812

parameters.name: NxtRteChgDte
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37814

parameters.name: RteChgFreq
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37813

parameters.name: RelDte
parameters.description:
Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37419

parameters.name: SeqNbr
parameters.description:
Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37420

parameters.name: Rte
parameters.description:
Cost-of-funds interest rate.  Applies to fixed-rate loans only.
Length: 9
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 32193

parameters.name: Indx
parameters.description:
Index number.  Identifies the index, as defined on Index Segment 125 of Bank Control, that is used to calculate the cost of funds rate.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.  
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32214

parameters.name: IndxOvr
parameters.description:
If the relationship is points based, enter the number of points the cost-of-funds rate floats over or under the index rate. 
Length: 8
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 35702

parameters.name: IndxOvrPct
parameters.description:
If the relationship is percentage-based, enter the percentage of the index at which the cost-of-funds rate floats.  
Length: 8
Decimals: 5
Element ID: 33647

parameters.name: Rlt
parameters.description:
Defines the relationship between the margin and the index (+, -, or %).
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32195

parameters.name: Flr
parameters.description:
Lowest rate that can be used to calculate the cost-of-funds accrual.
Length: 9
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 32196

parameters.name: Celng
parameters.description:
Highest rate that can be used to calculate the cost-of-funds accrual. 
Length: 9
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 32197

parameters.name: RteChgFreq
parameters.description:
Controls when the cost-of-funds interest rate changes in relation to when the cost-of-funds index changes.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.
 
 D Rate changes on a specific day of month in which the index changes. If the specific day is a nonworking day, the change occurs on the next working day.
 L Rate changes on the last work day of the month in which the index changes.
 N Rate changes on the next work day following the index change.
 2 Rate changes on the first working day of the month following the index change.
 3 Rate changes on the first work day of the quarter following the index change.
 0 Rate changes the day of an index change.
 R Rate changes the day following an index change.
 M Rate changes the Monday after an index change.
 T Rate changes the Tuesday after an index change.
 W Rate changes the Wednesday after an index change.
 H Rate changes the Thursday after an index change.
 F Rate changes the Friday after an index change.
 1 Rate changes the first day of the month following an index change.
 E Rate changes monthly following an index change.
 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32216

parameters.name: NxtRteChgDte
parameters.description:
Cost-of-funds rate review date.
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32215

parameters.name: StlmtFreq
parameters.description:
Along with the settlement term, represents the amount of time between the last settlement date and the next settlement date.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.
 
 0 Changed manually.  
 1 Daily.  
 2 Monthly.  
 3 Yearly.  

Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32217

parameters.name: StlmtTerm
parameters.description:
Along with settlement frequency, represents the amount of time between the last settlement date and the next settlement date.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32218

parameters.name: LstStlmtDte
parameters.description:
Last date that the cost of funds accrual amount was reset to zero.
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32221

parameters.name: NxtStlmtDte
parameters.description:
Next date that the cost of funds accrual amount is reset to zero.  Based on the last settlement date, settlement frequency, and settlement term, if available.
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32220

parameters.name: AccrAmt
parameters.description:
Cost-of-funds accrual from the last settlement date until today.
Length: 15
Decimals: 7
Element ID: 35705

parameters.name: IntAccrMTD
parameters.description:
Total cost-of-funds accrual for the month.
Length: 15
Decimals: 7
Element ID: 35706

parameters.name: IntAccrYTD
parameters.description:
Total cost-of-funds accrual for the year.
Length: 15
Decimals: 7
Element ID: 35707

parameters.name: IntAccrLTD
parameters.description:
Total cost-of-funds accrual for the life of the loan. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 7
Element ID: 35708

parameters.name: EffectiveUserId
parameters.description: For applications using a System ID to log in to FIS, this field can be used to specify the RACF user ID of the bank employee executing the API. When supplied, the Effective User ID is used to authorize, execute, and log the host transaction.

parameters.name: TranCde
parameters.description:
Identifies the type of monetary transaction and its effects.  
 550  Financed reserves will be rebated.  For simple interest loans, original charge-off transaction; accruing reserves are terminated and financed insurance is maintained.  For add-on loans, loan balance less unearned interest is charged off; financed insurance or dealer reserves continue.  
 551  For add-on loans only, partial charge-off transaction; reserves are terminated.  
 552  For add-on loans only, partial charge-off transaction; reserves are not terminated.  
 555  For add-on loans only, complete charge-off transaction; loan balance minus current unearned interest and current reserve balances is charged off; reserves are terminated.  
 556  For simple interest loans with financed insurance only, complete charge-off transaction; financed reserves are terminated.  
 560  For simple interest and add-on loans, increases charge-off balance of partially charged-off loans
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30050

parameters.name: AcctNbr
parameters.description:
Account number.
Length: 11
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30051

parameters.name: NoteNbr
parameters.description:
Note number.
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30054

parameters.name: NbrAccts
parameters.description:
Input:  The maximum number of accounts to return information about.  If left blank, all accounts related to the specified account will be returned.  

 Output:  The actual number of accounts returned.  

 For time deposit accounts, each time deposit ID is an occurrence within the structure.  The same is true for each note number within a loan account. 
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 9000

parameters.name: NbrAcctRltCust
parameters.description:
Input:  The maximum number, up to 25, of related customers to return information about.  If left blank, all customers related to the specified account will be returned.  If filled with a number less than the actual number of related customers, there is no message returned to indicate this, and there is no way to retrieve the next group of customers.  

 Output:  The actual number of related customers returned.  

 Not used in CIS Customer Profile function. 
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 9003

Decimals: 0

get.summary: Retrieve detailed information about a pending rate change for the specified range of floor plan notes
get.description: Category 1 API - This method is used to inquire on a pending rate change transaction for the specified range of floor plan notes.

parameters.name: organization-id
parameters.description: FIS processing organization ID

parameters.name: source-id
parameters.description: Source Id

parameters.name: application-id
parameters.description: Application Id

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Unique request identifier

parameters.name: security-token-type
parameters.description: Security Token Type

parameters.name: IBS-Authorization
parameters.description: IBS-Authorization is required if Client Certificate is not passed

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-sk
parameters.description: A base64-encoded AES 128 or 256 bit key that is used to encrypt the data items within the ReST message.

parameters.name: fis-ic-enc-x5ts256
parameters.description: (X.509 certificate SHA-256 thumbprint) - A base64-encoded SHA-256 thumbprint (a.k.a. digest) of the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate [RFC5280] corresponding to the public key used to encrypt information within this message.

parameters.name: EffectiveUserId
parameters.description: For applications using a System ID to log in to FIS, this field can be used to specify the RACF user ID of the bank employee executing the API. When supplied, the Effective User ID is used to authorize, execute, and log the host transaction.

parameters.name: AcctNbr
parameters.description:
Loan System account number. 
Length: 11
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30051

parameters.name: EffDte
parameters.description:
Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37403

parameters.name: RtePln
parameters.description:
Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered. 
Length: 7
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37449

parameters.name: RateOver
parameters.description:
For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37404

parameters.name: RateOverMargin
parameters.description:
For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37405

parameters.name: RateOverRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37406

parameters.name: RateUnder
parameters.description:
For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37408

parameters.name: RateUnderMargin
parameters.description:
For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37409

parameters.name: RateUnderRelInd
parameters.description:
Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %). 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37410

parameters.name: Index
parameters.description:
Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37413

parameters.name: SplitLimitAmt
parameters.description:
Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 37414

parameters.name: Basis
parameters.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37415

parameters.name: LNCategory
parameters.description:
Identifies the loan category for account-level rate changes (Rate Indicator is A).  Rate change will be applied only to notes of this category.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 R  Revolving credit.  
 S  Specific accounts receivable. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37416

parameters.name: PricePlan
parameters.description:
Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37417

parameters.name: RateCap
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change. 
Length: 10
Decimals: 6
Element ID: 37812

parameters.name: NxtRteChgDte
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37814

parameters.name: RteChgFreq
parameters.description:
For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37813

parameters.name: RelDte
parameters.description:
Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37419

parameters.name: SeqNbr
parameters.description:
Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37420

parameters.name: SelKwd
parameters.description:
Selection criteria keyword by which to select Bill Type F floor plan loans for rate change.  
 LNNFPOPT  Floor plan option.  
 LNNFPST  Floor plan status. 
Length: 8
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37421

parameters.name: KwdLow
parameters.description:
Low value of the Bill Type F selection criteria keyword range. 
Length: 7
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37422

parameters.name: KwdHi
parameters.description:
High value of the Bill Type F selection criteria keyword range. 
Length: 7
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 37423

post.summary: Create a HMDA record for the specified note
post.description:
Category 1 API - This method is used to add a HMDA record for the specified note.  

 In 2018, changes were made to satisfy new HMDA compliance reporting requirements.  FIS IBS Loans added 101 new element IDs to comply with this new requirement.  Nineteen of these new elements (E38203, E38206, E38213, E38219, E38227, E38228, E38229, E38230, E38231, E38235, E38236, E38237, E38238, E38239, E38247,E38248, E38249, E38263, E38250) are almost identical to existing HMDA elements (E35957, E35957, E35958, E32270, E32271, E35964, E32260, E32261, E32262, E32263, E35965, E32264, E32265, E32266, E32267, E35974, E35975, E35968, E35969, E32273) as the fields contain the same information.  The new fields were added because the existing fields required either a length or data format change to comply.  

 As a result, special mapping requirements will apply, based on the Data Collection Year (Element ID 38200).  The value in this field drives HMDA report processing.  In general, none of the elements in the 38200 - 38300 range, with the exception of element 38200 (Data Collection Year), are relevant when the data collection year is less than 2018

Loan System account number. 
Length: 11

parameters.name: NoteNbr
parameters.description:
Note number.
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30054

parameters.name: LNPmtSchedTyp
parameters.description:
Payment schedule type.  
 I  Interest (Payment Type 0).  
 T  Total (Payment Type other than 0).  
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30114

parameters.name: LNEffDte
parameters.description:
Effective date of the payment schedule.  Identifies the date of the first payment in the schedule.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30090

parameters.name: LNPmtTyp
parameters.description:
Payment type.  Determines the billing method for the loan.  Possible values are 0, A, B, C, D, E, F, G, J, and P.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for details of the different payment types. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32289

parameters.name: LNNbrOfPayments
parameters.description:
Number of payments.  The number of bills produced in a past schedule, or the number of bills to be produced in a current or future schedule.  
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32290

parameters.name: LNPmtFreq
parameters.description:
Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular (creates a bill effective date shown on the payment schedule but will not roll the next bill date forward).  
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32291

parameters.name: LNBusDay
parameters.description:
For revolving credit (Category R) loans, number representing the nth business day of the month on which the Revolving Credit Statement is produced.  Valid values are 1 through 18.  If this field is blank, statements are produced on the monthly anniversary date of the payment schedule effective date.  
Length: 2
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32292

parameters.name: LNPmtPct
parameters.description:
Percent of payment defined and used by Payment Types D, E, F, G, and P.  Any value between 000.00 and 100.00 is valid.  If Payment Type P, a value in this field overrides the value defined on Bank Control Payment Plan Segment 420. 
Length: 5
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 32293

parameters.name: LNMinPmtAmt
parameters.description:
Minimum payment amount defined and used by Payment Types D, E, F, G, and P.  Field is expressed in whole dollars with a maximum amount of 99999.  If Payment Type P, a value in this field overrides the value defined on Bank Control Payment Plan Segment 420. 
Length: 5
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32294

parameters.name: LNTotPmtAmt
parameters.description:
Amount of total payment, not including buydowns, for this schedule.  The amount is optional for interest-only schedules but is required for the remaining schedule types.  For Loan Category P, the initiating institution's P&I. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 32295

parameters.name: LNPIAmt
parameters.description:
For Bill Type A loans only, the fixed principal and interest portion of the payment. For Loan Category P, the initiating institutions P&I. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 32296

parameters.name: LNEscrAmt
parameters.description:
Escrow amount included in the total payment. 
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 32297

parameters.name: LNBuydwnAmt
parameters.description:
For Bill Type A loans only, portion of the payment supplied by someone other than a borrower.  
Length: 15
Decimals: 2
Element ID: 32298

parameters.name: LNChrgInd
parameters.description:
For automatic bill payments, indicates the type of account to which a bill is charged.  
 A  Automated Funds Transfer System.  
 D  DDA.  
 S   Savings. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32299

parameters.name: ChrgDdaNbr
parameters.description:
Identifies the DDA or savings account to which a bill is charged.
Length: 11
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32300

parameters.name: LNPmtPlnNbr
parameters.description:
For revolving credit (Category R) loans, identifies the payment plan used to calculate the payment, as defined on Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.  
Length: 2
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 32301

parameters.name: LNNewEffDte
parameters.description:
New effective date of the payment schedule.  Identifies the date of the first payment in the schedule.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 33395

parameters.name: LNOldPmtTyp
parameters.description:
Currently not used.  
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 33396

parameters.name: LNOldPmtFreq
parameters.description:
Old payment frequency.  Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular (creates a bill effective date shown on the payment schedule but will not roll the next bill date forward).   
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 33397

parameters.name: LNEditOnly
parameters.description:
A 'Y' in this field will cause the host system to perform the necessary edits on requested changes without actually making the changes. 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 33398

parameters.name: LNTotNxtBillDte
parameters.description:
If not an interest-only or maturity payment schedule, date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.  
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 36515

parameters.name: LNIntNxtBillDte
parameters.description:
If an interest-only or maturity payment schedule (Payment Type Zero), date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.  
Length: 10
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 36524

parameters.name: LNSrc
parameters.description:
Identifies the input source of the transaction. 
Length: 3
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30009

post.summary: Post a charge-off payment for the specified  note
post.description:
Category 1 API - This method is used to apply a payment to a note that has been completely or partially charged off. Before the charge-off payment can be applied, a regular payment must be posted to the customer side of the note using the Loan Note Payment function. It is possible to make only a charge-off payment if the customer record is paid in full and you recover an additional amount.

 This function can also be used to apply adjustments to accrued interest using Transaction Codes 677 or 725. The system does not require a payment to the customer side for these adjustments.

post.summary: Add name-address-phone information for specified loan account
post.description: Category 1 API - This method is used to add name and address information associated with a loan account.  There are nine name and address records available per account.  You specify which of these records you wish to add in the LNNmeAndAddrInd field.  The entire name and address must be entered.  First through fifth name/address lines are used for name and address, including ZIP code, exactly as it is to appear on mailings.  Do not leave any blank lines in the middle of the name/address information.  For credit bureau reported joint loans, each name must be on a separate line.  Some items, such as coupon books, credit bureau reports, and 1098 forms only permit four lines.  Interest paid year-to-date statements show up to five lines.  Please note that if name/address data already exists for the specified record (1-9), this method will replace it.

put.summary: Change name-address-phone information for specified loan account
put.description: Category 1 API - This method is used to change name and address information associated with a loan account.  There are nine name and address records available per account.  You specify which of these records you wish to change in the LNNmeAndAddrInd field.  The entire name and address must be entered since this method overlays all existing information.  First through fifth name/address lines are used for name and address, including ZIP code, exactly as it is to appear on mailings.  Do not leave any blank lines in the middle of the name/address information.  For credit bureau reported joint loans, each name must be on a separate line.  Some items, such as coupon books, credit bureau reports, and 1098 forms only permit four lines.  Interest paid year-to-date statements show up to five lines.

parameters.name: InBasis
parameters.description:
Identifies the payoff accrual basis.  Defaults to the loan accrual basis.  
 0 Actual-day month/360-day year
 3 30-day month/360-day year
 5 Actual-day month/365-day year
 7 Actual-day month/Actual-day year
 9 30-day month/365-day year 
 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30139

parameters.name: InPrinCd
parameters.description:
Indicates which balance (current or scheduled) and which accrual basis (loan accrual basis or payoff accrual basis) are used in calculating the loan payoff.  
 1Accrue on current balance from the last full, regular payment to the payoff date.
 2Accrue on current balance from the last regularly scheduled payment due date to the payoff date.
 3Accrue on amortized balance from the last regularly scheduled payment due date to the payoff date.
 
Length: 1
Decimals: 0
Element ID: 30140

parameters.name: InMonths
parameters.description:
If you want to withhold FHA insurance premiums from this quote, enter the number of months to withhold premiums.

Decimals: 0

LNFeeWavBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple transactions into one total.

LNFeeWavCnfrmNewFeeBal.description: Balance after waiver has been applied.

LNAcctNme.description: Short name of the account to which the transaction was applied.

LNFeeWavAmt.description: Amount of fee to be waived.

LNPmtPlnNbr.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans, identifies the payment plan used to calculate the payment, as defined on Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.

LNIntNxtBillDte.description: If an interest-only or maturity payment schedule (Payment Type Zero), date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNEditOnly.description: A 'Y' in this field will cause the host system to perform the necessary edits on requested changes without actually making the changes.

LNNewEffDte.description: New effective date of the payment schedule.  Identifies the date of the first payment in the schedule.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNOldPmtFreq.description:
Old payment frequency.  Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular (creates a bill effective date shown on the payment schedule but will not roll the next bill date forward).

LNNbrOfPayments.description: Number of payments.  The number of bills produced in a past schedule, or the number of bills to be produced in a current or future schedule.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

ChrgDdaNbr.description: Identifies the DDA or savings account to which a bill is charged.

LNPmtPct.description: Percent of payment defined and used by Payment Types D, E, F, G, and P.  Any value between 000.00 and 100.00 is valid.  If Payment Type P, a value in this field overrides the value defined on Bank Control Payment Plan Segment 420.

LNEscrAmt.description: Escrow amount included in the total payment.

LNEffDte.description: Effective date of the payment schedule.  Identifies the date of the first payment in the schedule.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNBusDay.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans, number representing the nth business day of the month on which the Revolving Credit Statement is produced.  Valid values are 1 through 18.  If this field is blank, statements are produced on the monthly anniversary date of the payment schedule effective date.

LNMinPmtAmt.description: Minimum payment amount defined and used by Payment Types D, E, F, G, and P.  Field is expressed in whole dollars with a maximum amount of 99999.  If Payment Type P, a value in this field overrides the value defined on Bank Control Payment Plan Segment 420.

LNTotNxtBillDte.description: If not an interest-only or maturity payment schedule, date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNChrgInd.description:
For automatic bill payments, indicates the type of account to which a bill is charged.  
 A  Automated Funds Transfer System.  
 D  DDA.  
 S   Savings.

LNTotPmtAmt.description: Amount of total payment, not including buydowns, for this schedule.  The amount is optional for interest-only schedules but is required for the remaining schedule types.  For Loan Category P, the initiating institution's P&I.

LNPmtFreq.description:
Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular (creates a bill effective date shown on the payment schedule but will not roll the next bill date forward).

LNPmtSchedTyp.description:
Payment schedule type.  
 I  Interest (Payment Type 0).  
 T  Total (Payment Type other than 0).

LNPmtTyp.description: Payment type.  Determines the billing method for the loan.  Possible values are 0, A, B, C, D, E, F, G, J, and P.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for details of the different payment types.

LNPIAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans only, the fixed principal and interest portion of the payment. For Loan Category P, the initiating institutions P&I.

LNBuydwnAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans only, portion of the payment supplied by someone other than a borrower.

LNBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple account payments into one total.

LNWarnMsg.description: Gives additional information about error conditions.

LNPartSpreadInd.description: Indicates whether to override the automatic participation spread field on the loan when that field is Y, indicating the system automatically distributes principal and interest portions of a payment to any associated participations. A Y in this field prevents automatic distributions.

LNEffDte.description: Transaction effective date.  Can be backdated.

LNBillSeq.description: Number assigned to the account bill by the system if there are multiple account bills with the same bill due date.

LNReleaseDte.description: Date on which the transaction will be processed. System enters the current date.

PrcsDte.description: The current loan system processing date.  If a date is not specified in Balance As Of Date field, this will represent the balance as of date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNUsrFlg2.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg1.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg5.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg4.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg3.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNPrpseCde.description:
Indicates the type of account and corresponds to the credit bureau field 'association code' for credit bureau reporting purposes.  
 B  Business.  
 J  Joint (personal).  
 S  Single (personal).  
 1-9  Personal (user-defined).

RepoNoteNbr.description: Used for repeat processing when multiple requests are needed to retrieve all of the notes for the account.

RepoPartNbr.description: Used for repeat processing when multiple requests are needed to retrieve all of the notes for the account.

LNDtlBillInd.description:
Indicates whether the account or note bill shows detailed history since the last bill was created.  
 D  Account or note receives detailed bills showing all history.  
 N  No, account or note receives summary bills showing only total amounts due.

LNAcctCurrrBal.description: Total note balance for all notes meeting inquiry criteria.  For loans with a nonaccrual or charge-off status, this reflects the actual customer balance.

BalAsOfDte.description: The date that the note balances reflect.  If this date is not entered, the current system date is used.  The current system date is returned in the Processing Date field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

InqSrchFld3.description:
Used to filter notes according to the following values:
 
 TLC for TLC notes only.
 OBP for Option-Based Pricing notes only.
 OBP + Option ID for Option-Based Pricing notes with the specified Option ID.

InqSrchFld2.description:
Used to filter notes according to the following values:
 
 ALL for all of the account�s loans.
 AR for accounts receivable loans.
 C for commercial loans.
 F for floor plan loans.
 I for installment loans.
 M for mortgages.
 R for revolving credit loans.

LNGuarEndrsmtInd.description: Indicates whether an account is endorsed or guaranteed.  Y or N.

LNCoborrowerSSN.description: Social security number of the coborrower.

LNRiskRte.description: User-defined risk rating for the account.

MoreInd.description: Indicates whether more notes are available to be retrieved.  Y or N.

RepoPartSeq.description: Used for repeat processing when multiple requests are needed to retrieve all of the notes for the account.

TotPrtBal.description: Total participation balance for all notes meeting inquiry criteria.

TotBnkShr.description: Total bank share for all notes meeting inquiry criteria.  Calculated as total note balance minus total participation balance.

CBCLInd.description: Indicates whether this commitment is for a collateral-based credit line.  Y or N.

RevAdv1Amt.description: Amount of the last revolving credit advance.

LNApplScr.description: For dealer-financed loans, the application score assigned by an external credit system.

FrclsrInd.description:
Indicates whether the note is in the foreclosure process.  
 Blank  Note is not in foreclosure.  
 A-9  User-defined code to indicate the foreclosure status.

RevAdv1Dte.description: Date of the last revolving credit advance.

MERSMINNbr.description: Identifies the mortgage identification number (MIN) that has been assigned to the mortgage as part of the Mortgage Electronic Registry System (MERS).  The MIN is a unique 18-digit number used to track a mortgage loan throughout its life, from origination to payoff or foreclosure.

FrclsrDte.description: Date the note was placed in foreclosure status.  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNRteChgFreq.description: For variable-rate loans, determines when the note interest rate changes based on changes to the related index.

TaxIdCde.description:
Identifies the type of taxpayer identification number.
 Keyword: TAXIDC
 N No number
 F Federal tax number
 S Social security number
 T Nonresident alien taxpayer identification number

IntPdYTD.description: Total of all interest paid on the note as of today for the current year.

StatCde.description: Loan status code.  Indicates whether the loan is partially or completely charged off, and whether the loan is earning interest.  May also identify the reason for nonaccrual or charge-off status.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for a complete list of status codes.

CurBal.description: Unpaid principal balance on processing date.

TimesLate120.description: Number of times payments were late for 120 days.

TLCNoteInd.description: Indicates whether the note is part of a TLC (total line of credit) relationship.

LNNExMt.description: For variable-plan loans, or variable-rate loans using the payment/term change feature, date of expected maturity.  Used by the system to amortize the balance of the loan when changing payment amounts.  If the expected maturity date is in the past or is zeroes, the system uses the loan maturity date to amortize the balance of the loan.

IntPdToDte.description: Date to which interest is paid.

HMDAInd.description: Indicates whether a loan is included on HMDA Loan Application Register.

LstHazInsDisbAmt.description: Amount of the last hazard insurance escrow disbursement amount (Note Escrow Category HAZ or HMO).

NxtPymtChgDte.description: Next payment change date for an adjustable-rate mortgage.

CommtDrawInd.description: Determines whether a draw can be made against a commitment. For revolving credit notes with an automatic draw delinquency indicator of Y, may reset to N when a bill remains unpaid for the number of days specified in AUTO DRAW DLQ DAYS.

BillLeadDays.description: Number of days before the payment due date that the bill will be produced.

CrBurStatCde.description: Code (in Metro 2 format) that specifies the current condition of the account for credit bureau reporting purposes.

LateChrgDue.description: Amount of any outstanding late charges.

HazInsExpDte.description: Date the hazard insurance policy expires.

LNTrckCde.description: User-defined code intended to identify the note for tracking purposes.

NbrInq.description: Number of voice response inquiries made on this note this month.

LNChrgAcct.description: Identifies the DDA or savings account to which bills are charged.

OrigBal.description: Original principal balance of the loan.

RevAdv2Amt.description: Amount of the second to last revolving credit advance.

PmtChgInd.description:
Determines if and how a variable-rate note payment/term changes.  
 0  No changes.  
 1  Payment amount changes when the rate changes because of an index change.  
 2  Payment amount changes on the next rate change date after an index change, regardless of whether the rate changes.  
 3  Maturity date, term, and number of payments change when the rate changes because of an index change; payment amount remains the same.

TimesLate60.description: Number of times payments were late for 60 days.

LNRiskRtg.description: User-defined code intended to identify the level of risk associated with the loan.

Type.description: Identifies a set of note options and defaults, as defined on Bank Control Note Option Segment 410.

RevAdv2Dte.description: Date of the second to last revolving credit advance.

LstHazInsDisbDte.description: Date of the last hazard insurance escrow disbursement (Note Escrow Category HAZ or HMO).

RsrvEscrBal.description: Balance of all regular reserve escrows.

LNNmeAddrInd.description: Number from 1 through 9 identifying the name and address record.

ErrNbr.description:
VRU system error number.  Valid values are:  
 001  Database unavailable.  
 002  Account not found.  
 003  Account segment not found.  
 006  PIN invalid.  
 009  Account blocked.

BkrptInd.description:
With the exception of the following system-defined values, a user-defined code intended to indicate the form of bankruptcy the customer has filed. 
0  No bankruptcy 
1   Chapter 7 
2   Chapter 11 
3   Chapter 12 
4   Chapter 13

PstNoTxn.description:
Determines how dollar transactions will post against the note.  

 Blank  Dollar transactions can post against the note.  
 1  Allow regular and special payments and payoffs, but not escrow disbursements.  
 2  Allow regular and special payments and payoffs, but not advances.  
 3-9  Reserved for future system-defined uses.  
 K  Allow only escrow disbursements.  
 P  Allow only payoff transactions. 
 A-J, L-O, Q-Z  User-defined values.  No dollar transactions can post against the note.

LNCelng1Ovr.description: For variable-rate or variable-plan loans, the highest rate at which the loan can accrue interest.

TimesLate30.description: Number of times payments were late for 30 days.

TimeLate15.description: Number of times payments were late for 15 days.

LNFlr1Ovr.description: For variable-rate or variable-plan loans, the lowest rate at which the loan can accrue interest.

RemngPymt.description: Number of payments remaining before maturity.

TLCCmmtInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is part of a TLC (total line of credit) relationship.

RsrvCat1.description: Lists the first reserve category associated with the note.

RsrvCat2.description: Lists the second reserve category associated with the note.

RsrvCat3.description: Lists the third reserve category associated with the note.

BkrptDte.description: Date the note was placed in bankruptcy status.

FHAADPCde.description: Identifies the FHA automated data processing (ADP) code.  ADP codes are used in the processing of FHA-insured home mortgages.  The codes correspond to the section of the National Housing Act under which home loans are insured.

IntPdPryr.description: Total of all interest paid on the note for the previous year.

SrlrNbr3.description: Serial number of the check for the third to last revolving credit advance.

NxtPayAmt.description: Amount of the earliest unpaid bill.

SrlrNbr1.description: Serial number of the check for the last revolving credit advance.

SrlrNbr2.description: Serial number of the check for the second to last revolving credit advance.

LNMrgnOvrideInd.description: For variable-plan loans, indicates whether the value in the index relationship field overrides the margin defined on Variable Plan Segment 460 of Bank Control.

DailyAccr.description: One day�s interest on the current balance at the current rate.

Term.description: Number of months used to calculate the periodic payments of both principal and interest that will be sufficient to retire a mortgage obligation.

LNScndyOffcr.description: Identifies the secondary officer as defined on Bank Control Officer Segment 110.

NxtPmtVolInsAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans, the voluntary insurance portion of the next payment due.

PMIInd.description: Indicates whether the PMI disbursed amount is allowed to be displayed on the 1098 or 6807/1098 combined form.  Y or N.

LNFnlScr.description: For dealer-financed loans, the final score assigned by an external credit system.

NxtPayDte.description: Due date of the earliest unpaid bill.

RCIntOnlyInd.description: Indicator on the loan system that allows banks to identify loans that need to have a special message printed on loan statements if a revolving credit loan is secured by real estate.

NxtPmtPIAmt.description: Principal and interest portion of the next payment due.

LstTaxDisbDte.description: Date of the last tax disbursement (Note Escrow Category TAX).

PdInd.description:
Indicates the paid status of the loan.  
 0  Not paid off.  
 C  Paid off, appears on the Credit Bureau Paid Out report (R-7201).  
 M  Not paid off, appears on the Miscellaneous Balances report (R-6228).  
 P  Paid off.  
 T  Transferred.  
 Z  Principal paid but interest due (Bill Type F only).

LNNAICSCde.description: NAICS (North American Industrial Classification System) code.

NextBillDteInd.description:
Indicates how to adjust the bill date if a note's next bill date falls on a non-processing day.  
 A  First processing day after.  
 B  Last processing day before.  
 N  Not using this feature (default).

RevAdv3Amt.description: Amount of the third to last revolving credit advance.

LNFedCallRptCde.description: Code identifying the loan classification for federal call reporting purposes, as defined on Classification Segment 415 of Bank Control.

TaxId.description:
Federal tax number, social security number, or nonresident alien taxpayer identification number, as identified by szTaxIdCde.
 Keyword:  TAXPNO

TimesLate90.description: Number of times payments were late for 90 days.

RevAdv3Dte.description: Date of the third to last revolving credit advance.

PayoffDte.description: Date of the payoff quote. Today�s processing date.

NxtPmtEscrAmt.description: Escrow portion of the next payment due.

PayoffAmt.description: Amount due to pay off the loan.

NxtTaxDisbDte.description: Date of the next tax escrow disbursement (Note Escrow Category TAX).

LeadDayOvrdeInd.description: Indicates whether billing lead days setup is overridden with the note type option on Bank Control.  If Y is entered, the user must enter billing lead days with keyword LNNLDTDY.

LstTaxEscrDisbAmt.description: Amount of the last tax escrow disbursement (Note Escrow Category TAX).

LNBillAllIntInd.description:
For Bill Type B, Payment Type B loans, indicates whether interest billed includes all interest due when the interest due exceeds the scheduled payment amount. 
 Y  Bill includes all interest due.  
 N  Bill includes only the scheduled payment amount of interest.

NxtHazInsDisbDte.description: Date of the next hazard insurance escrow disbursement (Note Escrow Category HAZ or HMO).

EscrBal.description: Total escrow balance for the loan, excluding regular reserve escrows.

RevCrAvailBal.description: Unused amount of the line of credit.

LogInd.description: Indicates whether to log this inquiry.  Y or N (default).

LoanCat.description:
Broad classification for identifying loans with similar processing characteristics.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 G  General accounts receivable.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 P  Purchased loan.  
 R  Revolving credit. 
 S  Specific accounts receivable.

LNIntTyp.description:
Identifies the interest accrual method.  
 A  Precomputed add-on interest.  
 D  Discount interest. 
 R  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only; simple interest in arrears on the average daily balance.  
 S  Simple interest in arrears.  
 V  Simple interest in advance.

CatFltr.description: Indicates which category of memos to return.  If this field is left blank, the system returns all memos associated with the account or note regardless of the memo�s category.

MoreInd.description: A 'Y' in this field indicates there are more memos to be returned.

AcctNbr.description: Appropriate account number from the application account database.

RepoMemoNbr.description: For requests to retrieve additional memos, this value is required.  This value will be returned to indicate the starting point of the next inquiry.

RecordLmt.description: This is the number of memos to be returned, up to the maxium of 25.

TypeFilter.description:
Indicates which type of memos to be returned.  If this field is left blank, the system returns all memos tied to the account regardless of the memo�s type. 
 S  Predefined.  
 U  User-defined.

zTrackFltr.description: If this field and the Account Number and Note Number fields are completed, the system displays all memos associated with the note and track code.

BnkNbr.description: Identifies participant company record defined on the Company Basic Maintenance screen.

CmmtPrtInd.description: Sold indicator. If sold will have a value of 'S.'

Prty.description: If using an ascending or descending payment method and/or funding method, identifies the order in which draws and/or payments are applied.

CmmtPrtNbr.description: Identifies the portion of a lead commitment sold to a participant.

UsedAmt.description: Internal processing field.  To perform maintenance after this inquiry, copy the data returned here into the corresponding PUT input field.

PrcPln.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.

Typ.description: Identifies commitment participation�s commitment type as defined on Commitment Type Segment 425. Defaults to the commitment type of the lead commitment.

RCInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment participation balance is reduced by  participation payments.  Defaults to the revolving credit indicator of the  lead commitment.  Y or N.

DelInd.description: Internal processing field.  To perform maintenance after this inquiry, copy the data returned here into the corresponding PUT input field.

VltryInsBilledNotPdAmt.description: Amount of voluntary insurance billed but not paid.

DayToStp.description: For category R loans, number of days loan is past due before insurance reserve stops accruing.

YTDAccr.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued year to date.

RteChgInd.description:
For category R loans, indicates the effect of a rate change made at the subcategory level. May default from Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).  Valid values are Y or N.  Default value is N.
 N Affects new reserve segments only.
 Y Affects new and existing reserve segments.

TrmntAge.description: For insurance reserves, age at which the customer�s coverage ceases and the reserve is automatically inactivated.  May default from the company record, as defined on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).  If entered, the Loan System will automatically calculate and fill LN Reserve Termination Date field accordingly.  Currently not available on inquiry.

ResrvRte.description: For reserves with an earnings/rebate method of 1, 3, or B, the rate at which the reserve accrues if different from the rate specified on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM). For insurance reserves, rate is per $1000.00 of coverage per day.

ChrgbkDte.description: System-calculated date after which the bank can no longer recover the full amount of the dealer reserve, based on the value specified in the CHARGEBACK DAYS field on Dealer Plan Segment 480 of Bank Control.

MTDPdAmt.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest paid month to date.

InsCapAmt.description: For accruing insurance, the maximum loan amount the company will insure. May default from the company record, as defined on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).

TrmntResnCde.description:
Indicates reason for termination of the reserve.
 0 Age termination feature not used, or reserve not terminated.
 1 Terminated at customer�s request.
 2 Terminated at request of financial institution.
 3 Terminated at request of company.
 4 Terminated due to death of insured.
 5 System termination - insured reached maximum age for coverage.
 6 Manual termination - insured reached maximum age for coverage.
 7 Coverage extended due to extension of loan.
 8-20 User-defined.

YTDPdAmt.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest paid year to date.

MTDAccr.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued month to date.

EarningRebateMeth.description: Indicates earnings/rebate calculation method for a reserve.  Valid values:  1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, S.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for meanings of the values.

EffDte.description: Date reserve begins earning or rebating.

LTDPdAmt.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest paid since the loan originated.

VltryInsPmtTyp.description:
For voluntary insurance, indicates how the premium is calculated if the customer�s loan payment changes. May default from Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM). 
 0 Not recalculated.
 1 Calculated as a percentage of principal and interest.
 2 Calculated as a percentage of principal and interest plus escrow.
 3 Calculated as a percentage of principal and interest plus escrow and other voluntary insurance.

CurAccr.description: The current amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued.

RsrvNbr.description: Identifies the insurance or dealer reserve.

LTDAccr.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued since the loan originated.

PrpseCde.description:
Identifies the type of company, as defined on Company Basic Maintenance (LNCBM).
 D Dealer.
 I Insurance.

ClaimFiledInd.description: Indicates whether a claim has been filed against the reserve.  Y or N.  Default value is N.

Amt.description: Total amount of the dealer or insurance reserve. For insurance with an earnings/rebate method of 6, the monthly or biweekly premium amount.

RecourseNbr.description: For dealer reserves, the percentage of the loan for which the bank is reimbursed if the customer defaults on the loan. Informational only.

PrepaidInd.description: Indicates whether the reserve is prepaid.  Y or N.  Default value is N.

VltryInsMaxPremAmt.description: For voluntary insurance, the maximum amount of the monthly premium. May default from the company record, as defined on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).

VltryInsPndAmt.description: Amount of the currently pending voluntary insurance premium. On the pending premium date, the pending premium overrides the current amount if the amounts are different.

TrmntDte.description: Date on which the reserve is terminated. Defaults to loan maturity date.   If LN Reserve Termination Age field is entered, Loan System will automatically calculate and fill this field accordingly.

CoNbr.description: Identifies a set of company options and defaults, as defined on Company Basic Maintenance (LNCBM).

Subcategory.description: Identifies a company subcategory, as defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

Cat.description: Identifies a company category, as defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

VltryInsPndDte.description: For voluntary insurance, the effective date of the pending premium.

BenAmt.description: For reserve earnings/rebate method S only, the payment amount on which the daily accrual calculation is based.  For all other reserve earnings/rebate methods, the field defaults to 0.00 and will not allow entry.

Kywrd.description: Keyword associated with the new data.  For a complete list of keywords, see 'Keyword List' in the Appendix of the User Manual.

AcctNbr.description: Account number associated with the keyword.

NewData.description: The new value for the keyword.  Each data type has its own range of size and content.  Data is entered from the left.  Punctuation is necessary for fields containing dollar values to ensure accuracy.

FeeID.description: Fee plan and fee number.  The first two characters identify the fee plan and the following three digits identify the fee number.

NoteNbr.description: Note number associated with the keyword.

NmeAddrNbr.description: Number corresponding to the name/address record (1-9).

AcctSum.description:
Account summary type.
 S Short-Term Notes
 L Long-Term Notes

TiedTo.description: Note or commitment number to which the fee is tied.

EarnMethInd.description: Method of earnings for this fee.

BillFreq.description:
Frequency of billing for account- and commitment-level fees.
 1 Daily.
 2 Monthly.
 3 Quarterly.
 4 Semiannual.
 5 Annual.

Typ.description:
Fee Type.
 A Account fee.
 N Note fee.
 C Commitment fee.

CurAssessAmt.description: Amount which has been assessed to this account since the last bill.

CatCde.description:
Fee Category.
 LT Late fee.
 EX Extension fee.
 MS Miscellaneous fee.
 CS Cost.
 PP Prepayment penalty fee.

TotAmtDue.description: Total amount which has been billed on this fee for this account.

CurAmtDue.description: Amount which has been billed to this account for the current period.

UnearnAmt.description: Remaining amount of fee to be taken into earnings over time.

EarnAmt.description: Total amount of fee taken into earnings.

AmtWaivYTD.description: Amount which has been waived on this fee for this account.

DelInd.description:
Indicates if the fee is deleted.
 Y Yes.  The fee is deleted.
 N or blank No.  The fee is not deleted.

UptDte.description: Date of last update.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

UptUsr.description: User ID that performed the last update.

LNCommtNbr.description: Identifies the commitment number.  The commitment number is required to update commitment level user-defined fields.

PmtsMade.description: The number of scheduled regular payments paid on the loan.

TrmntResn.description:
Reason the reserve was terminated.
 001 Request of the client.
 002 Request of the financial institution.
 003 Request of the insurance company.
 004 Death of the insured.
 005 System calculated that insured reached maximum allowable age.
 006 Manual entry to indicate that insured reached maximum allowable age.
 007 Insurance coverage extended as a result of loan maturity extension.
 008 - 020 User-defined.

LstCancellationDte.description: Last date on which the insurance accruals were stopped.

TrmntAge.description: Customer age when the reserve should be terminated.

DayToStpAccr.description: Indicates how many days past due the loan must be before the insurance reserve stops accruing. Zero if the stop accrual feature is not used.

ClaimFiled.description: Indicates whether an insurance claim has been filed.

CompNbr.description: Identifies the company with which the reserve is associated.

CurRebateAmt.description: Current amount of reserve which would be rebated if the loan were paid off.

CurGoodThruDte.description: Last date the current reserve rebate is valid, as defined on Note Option Segment 410 of Bank Control.

ChrgBckOpt.description:
Determines whether all or part of a prepaid dealer reserve can be recovered by your financial institution from the dealer at loan payoff or chargeoff.  Valid values are A, B or N.
 A Chargeback any unearned portion of the reserve.
 B Chargeback entire reserve if payoff or charge-off occurs within the chargeback period.  Chargeback any unearned portion of reserve if payoff or charge-off occurs after the chargeback period.
 N No chargeback if charge-off or payoff occurs after the chargeback period.   Chargeback entire reserve if payoff or charge-off occurs within the chargeback period.

NxtGoodThruDte.description: Last date the next reserve rebate is valid, as defined on Note Option Segment 410 of Bank Control.

VolPndAmt.description: For voluntary insurance Payment Types 1, 2, or 3, recalculated payment amount that becomes effective when the payment schedule changes.

ChrgBckPmts.description: The number of scheduled regular payments (610-629 tran code that satisfies a bill segment) from the reserve effective date that the entire reserve can be charged back to the dealer.  Valid values are 000-999. Defined on Dealer Plan Segment 480 of Bank Control.

RcsCde.description: Percentage of loan balance for which the dealer is responsible if the borrower defaults.

VolMaxPremAmt.description: Highest voluntary insurance premium allowed. May default from the Company Category Maintenance screen (LNCCM).

EffDte.description: Reserve effective date.

StpAccrInd.description: Indicates whether the insurance reserve has stopped accruing.
