 001  Database unavailable.  
 002  Account not found.  
 003  Account segment not found.  
 006  PIN invalid.  
 009  Account blocked.

BkrptInd.description:
With the exception of the following system-defined values, a user-defined code intended to indicate the form of bankruptcy the customer has filed. 
0  No bankruptcy 
1   Chapter 7 
2   Chapter 11 
3   Chapter 12 
4   Chapter 13

PstNoTxn.description:
Determines how dollar transactions will post against the note.  

 Blank  Dollar transactions can post against the note.  
 1  Allow regular and special payments and payoffs, but not escrow disbursements.  
 2  Allow regular and special payments and payoffs, but not advances.  
 3-9  Reserved for future system-defined uses.  
 K  Allow only escrow disbursements.  
 P  Allow only payoff transactions. 
 A-J, L-O, Q-Z  User-defined values.  No dollar transactions can post against the note.

LNCelng1Ovr.description: For variable-rate or variable-plan loans, the highest rate at which the loan can accrue interest.

TimesLate30.description: Number of times payments were late for 30 days.

LNFlr1Ovr.description: For variable-rate or variable-plan loans, the lowest rate at which the loan can accrue interest.

RemngPymt.description: Number of payments remaining before maturity.

TLCCmmtInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is part of a TLC (total line of credit) relationship.

RsrvCat1.description: Lists the first reserve category associated with the note.

RsrvCat2.description: Lists the second reserve category associated with the note.

RsrvCat3.description: Lists the third reserve category associated with the note.

BkrptDte.description: Date the note was placed in bankruptcy status.

FHAADPCde.description: Identifies the FHA automated data processing (ADP) code.  ADP codes are used in the processing of FHA-insured home mortgages.  The codes correspond to the section of the National Housing Act under which home loans are insured.

IntPdPryr.description: Total of all interest paid on the note for the previous year.

SrlrNbr3.description: Serial number of the check for the third to last revolving credit advance.

NxtPayAmt.description: Amount of the earliest unpaid bill.

SrlrNbr1.description: Serial number of the check for the last revolving credit advance.

SrlrNbr2.description: Serial number of the check for the second to last revolving credit advance.

LNMrgnOvrideInd.description: For variable-plan loans, indicates whether the value in the index relationship field overrides the margin defined on Variable Plan Segment 460 of Bank Control.

DailyAccr.description: One day’s interest on the current balance at the current rate.

Term.description: Number of months used to calculate the periodic payments of both principal and interest that will be sufficient to retire a mortgage obligation.

LNScndyOffcr.description: Identifies the secondary officer as defined on Bank Control Officer Segment 110.

NxtPmtVolInsAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans, the voluntary insurance portion of the next payment due.

PMIInd.description: Indicates whether the PMI disbursed amount is allowed to be displayed on the 1098 or 6807/1098 combined form.  Y or N.

LNFnlScr.description: For dealer-financed loans, the final score assigned by an external credit system.

LNPaperFeedInd.description: Determines whether paper statements are produced for PCM accounts or for statements produced using CSF.  Y or N.

NxtPayDte.description: Due date of the earliest unpaid bill.

RCIntOnlyInd.description: Indicator on the loan system that allows banks to identify loans that need to have a special message printed on loan statements if a revolving credit loan is secured by real estate.

NxtPmtPIAmt.description: Principal and interest portion of the next payment due.

LstTaxDisbDte.description: Date of the last tax disbursement (Note Escrow Category TAX).

PdInd.description:
Indicates the paid status of the loan.  
 0  Not paid off.  
 C  Paid off, appears on the Credit Bureau Paid Out report (R-7201).  
 M  Not paid off, appears on the Miscellaneous Balances report (R-6228).  
 P  Paid off.  
 T  Transferred.  
 Z  Principal paid but interest due (Bill Type F only).

LNNAICSCde.description: NAICS (North American Industrial Classification System) code.

NextBillDteInd.description:
Indicates how to adjust the bill date if a note's next bill date falls on a non-processing day.  
 A  First processing day after.  
 B  Last processing day before.  
 N  Not using this feature (default).

ComtUnusedBal.description: Difference between the current commitment amount and commitment used amount.

RevAdv3Amt.description: Amount of the third to last revolving credit advance.

LNFedCallRptCde.description: Code identifying the loan classification for federal call reporting purposes, as defined on Classification Segment 415 of Bank Control.

TaxId.description: Federal tax number, social security number, or nonresident alien taxpayer identification number, as identified by LN Tax ID Code.

TimesLate90.description: Number of times payments were late for 90 days.

LNAcctClosDte.description: Date the loan account was closed.

ComtCurBal.description: Current approved amount of the commitment.

RevAdv3Dte.description: Date of the third to last revolving credit advance.

PayoffDte.description: Date of the payoff quote. Today’s processing date.

LNPrmyOffcr.description: Identifies the primary officer as defined on Bank Control Officer Segment 110.

NxtPmtEscrAmt.description: Escrow portion of the next payment due.

PayoffAmt.description: Amount due to pay off the loan.

NxtTaxDisbDte.description: Date of the next tax escrow disbursement (Note Escrow Category TAX).

LeadDayOvrdeInd.description: Indicates whether billing lead days setup is overridden with the note type option on Bank Control.  If Y is entered, the user must enter billing lead days with keyword LNNLDTDY.

LstTaxEscrDisbAmt.description: Amount of the last tax escrow disbursement (Note Escrow Category TAX).

LNBillAllIntInd.description:
For Bill Type B, Payment Type B loans, indicates whether interest billed includes all interest due when the interest due exceeds the scheduled payment amount. 
 Y  Bill includes all interest due.  
 N  Bill includes only the scheduled payment amount of interest.

NxtHazInsDisbDte.description: Date of the next hazard insurance escrow disbursement (Note Escrow Category HAZ or HMO).

EscrBal.description: Total escrow balance for the loan, excluding regular reserve escrows.

RevCrAvailBal.description: Unused amount of the line of credit.

LoanCat.description:
Broad classification for identifying loans with similar processing characteristics.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 G  General accounts receivable.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 P  Purchased loan.  
 R  Revolving credit. 
 S  Specific accounts receivable.

LNIntTyp.description:
Identifies the interest accrual method.  
 A  Precomputed add-on interest.  
 D  Discount interest. 
 R  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only; simple interest in arrears on the average daily balance.  
 S  Simple interest in arrears.  
 V  Simple interest in advance.

LNElecFeedInd.description: Determines whether electronic statements are produced for PCM  accounts or for statements produced using CSF.  Y or N.

LNBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple loan transactions into one total.

LNPmtPlnNbr.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans with a payment type of P only, identifies the payment plan used to calculate the payment, as defined on  Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.

LNNewBillTyp.description:
Bill type code.  
 0 (zero)  Bill-cycled loan  
 A  Paid-date to paid-date loan  
 B  Bill-cycled with bill segments  
 C  Payment-cycled loan  
 P   Pooled billing

LNEffDteOfRteChg.description: Effective date (MMDDYY) of rate change.  System automatically adjusts accruals.

LNNewIntRte.description: For fixed rate, interest rate of the note.  For fixed split rate loans, enter the rate for the balance over the split rate limit.  For example, 9.5% is entered as 009.500000.  For floating rate, do not enter.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note.  Default is 000.000000%.  Note:  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

LNPmtMeth.description:
User can specify how the payment should be spread to participations.  
 P  Prorata  
 A  Ascending sequential  
 D  Descending sequential  
 If this field is left blank, the payment method defaults to that specified on the note when payments are spread automatically to parts sold.  (This field is applicable only when parts sold exist under a note and the user has turned on the automatic parts indicator for the note.)

LNRltIndx.description: Index to which this loan is related.  Index must be set up on Bank Control.  Enter only if changing the index.

LNNbrOfPayments.description: Number of payments for the payment schedule.  Field is required but will default to '999' for demand loans.  Must be 1 if payment frequency is 5 (maturity) or 9 (irregular).

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNPrcPlnNbr.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

LNAcctNewTotOwed.description: Bank's share of the total owed on the account after the transaction.

LNPmtPct.description: To be used with Payment Types D, E, F, and G.  Any value between 000.00 and 100.00 may be entered.

LNEscrAmt.description: Full portion of the payment for all regular escrows only.  Default is zeros.

LNTxnCde.description: Identifies the type of transaction.

LNEffDte.description: Date (MMDDYY) the principal payment is effective for accrual purposes.

LNDtePdTo.description: Date (MMDDYY) to which interest is paid.

LNBusDay.description: For revolving credit loans (Category R), number representing the nth business day of the month on which you want the revolving credit statements to print each month.  Values are 1 through 18.  For example, if you enter 5, statements will print on the 5th processing day of the month.  If this field is blank, revolving credit statements will be printed on the monthly anniversary date of the payment schedule effective date.

LNMinPmtAmt.description: To be used with payment types D, E, F, and G.  Field is expressed in whole dollars, with a maximum amount of 99999.

LNAcctOldTotOwed.description: Bank's share of the total owed on the account before the transaction.

LNChrgInd.description:
Code to indicate if this note is to have billings charged to a DDA or savings account.  
 D  DDA  
 S  Savings  
 P  Trust account P (currently not used)  
 I  Trust account I (currently not used)  
 A  Automated charge through other account (AFT, ACH, etc.)

LNIntPmt.description: Amount (dollars and cents) of the interest payment if applicable.

LNBasis.description:
Code for the accrual basis.  Enter only if changing the basis code.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year  
 3  30-day month/360-day year  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year  
 7   Actual-day month/actual-day year  
 9  30-day month/365-day year

LNTotPmtAmt.description: Amount (dollars and cents) of new scheduled payment.  For loans with a scheduled principal payment, this field must contain an amount.  Must be zeroes if loan category is G, F, or S.  Must be entered for payment types A, B, or C.  For buydowns, the amount of the buydown should not be included.  Amount should  include all others, including voluntary insurance.

LNPartIntDte.description: User can specify a date for calculating the part interest payment portion.  No default exists.  If parts sold exist under a note and the user has turned on the automatic parts indicator for the note, the system requires that this date be entered.  If this date is different than the interest-paid-to date entered above, the system will pay the part�s interest differently than the note�s interest. (This field is applicable only when parts sold exist under a note and the user has turned on the automatic parts indicator for the note.)

LNLNBalPmt.description: Amount (dollars and cents) of the principal reduction, or total amount of payment for type A loans.

LNPmtEffDte.description: Date (MMDDYY) the new payment schedule begins.  If payment frequency is 5, this is the maturity date.  If you want billing day to always be last day of month, enter 99 in the DD portion of date.  All other values (1-30) continue to bill on the DD entered.  For paid-date loans, this date cannot be 29 or 30.  For accounts receivables, floor plan, and any loans that are to receive pooled billings, a date must be entered containing 99 in the DD portion.

LNChrgDdaNbr.description: Account number if the billings are to be charged to a DDA, savings, trust account or automated charge through other account.

LNAcctNme.description: The name associated with the account.

LNPartSpreadOvride.description: User can enter 'Y' in this field to bypass the automatic spreading of a payment to participations sold.  (This field is applicable only when parts sold exist under a note and the user has turned on the automatic parts indicator for the note.)

LNNewRteMrgn.description: For fixed rate, do not enter.  For floating rate, the numeric relation to the index rate; expressed as points or a percent.  Also used for variable split rate loans.  For notes tied to a variable plan, do not enter; will default to the variable plan information.  Default is 0.

LNPmtFreq.description:
Code indicating billing frequency.  
 1  Monthly  
 2  Quarterly  
 3  Semiannual  
 4  Annual  
 5  Maturity date billing only  
 9  Irregular  
 All pooled billings must have a payment frequency of 1.  Any note to be coded as due on demand cannot have a payment frequency of 5.

LNPmtTyp.description: New payment type.  0, A, B, C, D, E, F, or G.  See Loan System Reference Manual for information on the different types.

LNPIAmt.description: Fixed principal and interest portion of a payment for paid-date to paid-date processing, Bill Type A loans.  For Loan Category P, this is the correspondent's payment.

LNNewMrgnRltToIndx.description: For fixed rate, do not enter.  For floating rate, enter the relationship of the 'margin over' to the index.  Enter a +, - or %.  Also used for variable split rate loans. For notes tied to a variable plan, do not enter.  Will default to the variable plan.  Default is 0.

LNTimesRenewed.description: Number of times note has been renewed.

LNLNNewBal.description: New loan balance after the transaction is applied.

LNBuydwnAmt.description: Portion of the payment that is the buydown amount.  Default is zeroes.  Bill type must be A.  Payment type must be B.

LNRnwlDte.description: Date the note was renewed.  If left blank, the default is the current processing date.  This field is informational only; it does not change the way renewals are processed.

StrtDte.description: Payment due date of the first coupon to be ordered, or the default value, which is the next unbilled payment.

LstStrtDte.description: Payment due date of the first coupon ordered in the previous coupon order.

LstAnalysisDte.description: Date that the escrow payment will change as a result of the next escrow analysis.

CpnDropResn.description:
Coupon Drop Code.
 0 Not applicable
 1 Produce coupon book now
 2 Produce coupon book one month in advance
 3 Do not produce coupon books
 Coupon Reason Code.
 0 No coupons used for this note
 1 New note needs coupons
 2 Next coupon book for existing note
 3 Reorder a book

LstNumOrdr.description: Number of coupons ordered in the previous coupon order.

NxtBillDte.description: Date of the next undropped bill. This date is the default date for the COUPON START DATE field.

LstOrdDte.description: Date the note last appeared on the Coupon Order report (R-7200).

NxtPmtChgDte.description: Date the payment will change on the variable plan note.

NbrCpn.description:
Number of coupons to be ordered, or the default value, which is the computed number of payments from the payment due date of first coupon through (and inclusive of) the payment due date of last coupon.
 Tip: If the number of coupons you order is greater than the number of coupons specified on Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, you will receive the following message: WARNING: NUMBER OF COUPONS EXCEEDS FREQUENCY ON NOTE TYPE. The order will still be processed.

ThroughDte.description:
Payment due date of the last coupon to be ordered, or the default value, which is the earliest of the following dates:
 - Last installment on the note�s payment schedule
 - Next variable plan payment change date minus one payment
 - Automatic coupon order date minus one payment
 - Maturity date
 - Next payment effective date

NxtPmtDueDte.description: Date of the oldest unpaid bill.

NxtStrtDte.description: Date of the first coupon of the next book to be ordered.

NxtAnalysisDte.description: Date that the escrow payment will change as a result of the next escrow analysis.

NteLstPmtSchedDte.description: Final installment date of the note�s final payment schedule.

NteNoBillInd.description: Indicates how the borrower will be billed. This field must be C (coupons) or L (coupons for regular payments, bills for late charge fees) to order coupons through the Coupon Order function.

BkrptInd.description:
With the exception of the following system-defined values, a user-defined code intended to indicate the form of bankruptcy the customer has filed. 
0  No bankruptcy 
1   Chapter 7 
2   Chapter 11 
3   Chapter 12 
4   Chapter 13

LNTotLstBillDte.description: Date of the last principal or principal and interest billing.

LNIndx.description: For variable-rate loans, identifies the index number used to calculate the interest rate, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

LNNxtRteChgDte.description: For variable-rate or variable-plan loans, date when the rate is next eligible to change.

LNCollCde.description: With the exception of the system-defined values of A or blank for the first digit, two-digit user-defined code identifying the loan collateral.  If the first digit is A or blank, the loan is reported to the credit bureau as unsecured; for all other values, the loan is reported as secured.

FrclsrInd.description: User-defined code intended to indicate that a note is in foreclosure.

NxtPmtDueDteForTheLN.description: For Bill Type 0 loans, the date of the next bill to be generated.  For all other loans, the date of the next scheduled payment due on the note.

LNNoteLvlCalcBlendedRte.description: The blended rate for a tiered rate plan.

EscrResrvInd.description: Escrow reserve indicator.  Y or N.

LNIntRte1Undr.description: For split-rate or rate plan loans, the accrual rate on any balance up to and including the split-rate limit.

BkrptDte.description: Date the note was placed in bankruptcy status.

FrclsrDte.description: Date the note was placed in foreclosure status.  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNNoteTerm.description: Number of months between loan issue date and loan maturity date.

LNPdStat.description:
Indicates the paid status of the loan.  
 0  Not paid off.  
 C  Paid off, appears on the Credit Bureau Paid Out report (R-7201).  
 M  Not paid off, appears on the Miscellaneous Balances report (R-6228).  
 P  Paid off.  
 T  Transferred.  
 Z  Principal paid, but interest due (Bill Type F only).

NxtPayAmt.description: Amount of the earliest unpaid bill.

IntPdYtd.description: Interest paid since the beginning of the current year.

LNNoteBrnchNbr.description: Identifies the branch to which the loan is assigned, as defined on Branch Segment 105 of Bank Control.

LNNoteCurBal.description: Unpaid principal balance on the processing date.

LN231NotePmtSchedFreq.description:
Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular; creates a bill effective date shown on the payment schedule but will not roll the next bill date forward.

LNRteTyp.description:
Indicates the type of rate structure for all rate levels associated with the rate plan, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  
 B  Bracketed; notes accrue at a single rate for the entire balance of the loan.  
 T  Tiered; notes accrue at multiple rates for various balance portions.

TotLNFeesDue.description: Total late, extension, payoff, and miscellaneous fees due.

LNNoteOffcrNbr.description: Identifies the primary officer responsible for the loan, as defined on Officer Segment 110 of Bank Control.

LNNoteStat.description:
Indicates whether the loan is partially or completely charged off, and whether the loan is earning interest.  May also identify the reason for nonaccrual or charge-off status.  
 A  Accruing.  
 B  Not accruing; bankruptcy.  
 C  Completely charged off.  
 CA  Partially charged off; active balance accruing.  
 CB  Partially charged off; active balance not accruing; bankruptcy.  
 CD  Partially charged off; deferred active.  
 CJ  Partially charged off; active balance not accruing; judgment.  
 CN  Partially charged off; active balance not accruing.  
 CR  Partially charged off; active balance not accruing; repossession.  
 DA  Deferred active.  
 J  Not accruing; judgment.  
 N  Not accruing.  
 R  Not accruing; repossession.

TLCNoteInd.description: Indicates whether the note is part of a TLC (total line of credit) relationship.

LNMrgn1Ovr.description: For variable-rate or variable-plan loans.  If LN Relationship 1 (Over) is + or -, the number of points above or below the index at which the loan�s rate is floating.  If LN Relationship 1 (Over) is %, reflects the percentage of the index at which the loan�s rate is floating.

LNSecuredInd.description:
Indicates whether the loan is secured by collateral on the Collateral System.  For institutions with officer lending limits established on Officer Segment 110 of Bank Control, also indicates whether the loan is secured.  
 B  Secured, but collateral not on Collateral System.  
 S  Secured with collateral on Collateral System.  
 U  Unsecured.

LNBillTyp.description:
Controls the way bill segments are created and affects how payments are applied.  
 0  Bill-cycled (without bill segments); floor plan (floor plan indicator on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is 0).  
 A  Due date-to-due date or amortizing.  
 B  Bill-cycled (with bill segments).  
 C  Payment date-to-payment date.  
 F  Bill-cycled (with bill segments); floor plan (floor plan indicator on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is 2).

LN231NotePmtSchedTyp.description:
Determines the payment method for the loan.  
 0  No scheduled principal payments; interest only, or principal and interest due at maturity.  
 A  Fixed principal and/or fixed escrow amount plus accrued interest.  
 B  Fixed payment amount including principal and interest.  
 C  Payment amount is principal only; interest is billed at maturity or on a separate schedule.  
 D  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only. Payment amount is calculated by adding the current principal balance to the cycle-to-date accrued interest and multiplying that sum by the payment percent.  Any other billing elements (for example, fees or reserves) are added to the calculated payment amount.  
 E  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only.  Principal portion of the payment is calculated by multiplying the current principal balance by the payment percent. Any other billing elements (for example, finance charge for the cycle, fees, or reserves) are added to the calculated principal amount.  
 F  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only.  Payment amount is calculated by multiplying the current principal balance by the payment percent.  This calculation is then compared to the minimum payment amount (if applicable).  The system bills for the greater of the two plus any other billing elements (for example, fees or reserves).  
 G  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only.  Payment amount is calculated by multiplying the current principal balance by the payment percent.  Then the cycle-to-date accrued interest is added.  This calculation is then compared to the minimum payment amount (if applicable). The system will bill for the greater of the two plus any other billing elements (for example, fees or reserves).  
 J  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only.  Payment amount is calculated by adding the current principal balance to the current accrued interest and multiplying that sum by the payment percent.  Any other billing elements (for example, fees or reserves) are added to the calculated payment amount.  This calculation is then compared to the minimum payment amount (if applicable).  The system bills for the greater of the two.  
 P  For revolving credit (Category R) loans only.  Payment type defined on Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.  A payment plan number is required with this value.

IntPdToDte.description: Date to which interest is paid.

LNUsrFlg2.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg1.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg5.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg4.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNUsrFlg3.description: User-defined code used to group accounts for reporting purposes.

LNActyAllowed.description:
Determines how dollar transactions will post against the note.  

 Blank  Dollar transactions can post against the note.  
 1  Allow regular and special payments and payoffs, but not escrow disbursements.  
 2  Allow regular and special payments and payoffs, but not advances.  
 3-9  Reserved for future system-defined uses.  
 K  Allow only escrow disbursements.  
 P  Allow only payoff transactions. 
 A-J, L-O, Q-Z  User-defined values.  No dollar transactions can post against the note.

IntPdEopy.description: Amount of interest paid in the previous calendar year.

LNOrigBal.description: Original principal balance (amount financed) of the loan.

PayoffDte.description: Effective date of the payoff quote.

LNVarPlnNbr.description: For variable-plan loans, identifies the rate payment plan associated with the loan, as defined on Variable Plan Segment 460 of Bank Control.

LNNoteTyp.description: Identifies a set of note options and defaults, as defined on Note Option Segment 410 of Bank Control.

LNNumDayPstDueTdy.description: Numbers of days past due today. Does not reflect any payments made today.

LNNoteIntRte1Ovr.description: For loans with a fixed rate, the rate at which the loan accrues interest.  For split-rate or rate plan loans, the accrual rate on any balance over the split-rate limit.  For variable-rate or variable-plan loans, the current rate at which the loan accrues interest.

LNTotNxtBillDte.description: Due date of the next principal or principal and interest bill.

LNPrinTyp.description:
Broad indication of the initial loan term for reporting purposes.  
 D  Due on demand.  
 R  More than one year.  
 T  One year or less.  
 V  Revolving.

LNRlt1Ovr.description: For variable-rate or variable-plan loans, indicates if the loan�s rate is floating above (+), below (-), or as a percentage (%) of the index.

LN231NoteNxtDueDte.description: For Bill Type 0 loans, the date of the next bill to be generated.  For all other loans, the date of the next scheduled payment due on the note.

TotAmt.description: Total amount due to pay off loan.

LNSndNoBillInd.description:
Determines method of billing used for the loan.  
 A  Bill is addressed to customer address listed on the note.  
B  Bill is addressed in care of the financial institution.  
C  Coupons; no bills sent.  
 D  Automated charge through ACH.  
 E  Automated charge through ACH and bill addressed to customer address listed on the note.  
 L  Coupons for regular payments and bills for late charge fees.  
 N  None; bills or coupons not produced.

LNCmmtNbr.description: Identifies the commitment associated with the loan.

LNLNCat.description:
Broad classification for identifying loans with similar processing characteristics.  
 C  Commercial. 
 F  Floor plan.  
 G  General accounts receivable.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 P  Purchased loan. 
 R  Revolving credit.  
 S  Specific accounts receivable.

LNCollDesc.description: User-defined description of collateral supporting the loan.

LNHistNonLateFeeAmt.description: Portion of the transaction amount that was applied to fees other than late charges.

LNHistTotTranAmt.description: Total dollar amount of the transaction.

LNNteTransSrcCde.description: Identifies the source of the transaction.  For a complete list of source codes, see Input Sources in the Loans Appendix.

NoteTranAmtIntegerFmt.description: Amount of transaction in integer format.

LNNoteHistSeqNbr.description: System-defined number identifying multiple transactions with the same effective date.

NoteTranAmtDolrFmt.description: Amount of transaction in dollar format.

NoteTranAmtAdjmtFmt.description: Amount of transaction in adjustment format.

LNHistLNCurrBal.description: Principal balance after the transaction posts.

LNHistPrinTranAmt.description: Portion of the transaction amount that was applied to principal.

LNHistDescDta.description: User-entered transaction description.  Only available for certain transaction codes.  For standard transactions, this field is empty.

LNHistEscrResrvAmt.description: Portion of the transaction amount that was applied to reserve escrow.

LNNteTransCntrlNbr.description: Identifies either the user ID, teller cash drawer number, time posted, item sequence number, or batch sequence number based on the source code.  For a complete list of control numbers, see Input Sources in the Loans Appendix.

LNHistIntTranAmt.description: Portion of the transaction amount that was applied to interest.

LNHistRevrslInd.description: A 'R' in this field indicates transaction has been reversed.

LNHistEscrAmt.description: Portion of the transaction amount that was applied to escrow.

LNHistLtChrgAmt.description: Portion of the transaction amount that was applied to late charges.

NoteTranAmtRteFmt.description: The new interest rate for rate change transaction.

LNHistUnapplFndAmt.description: Portion of the transaction amount that was applied to unapplied funds.

MoreInd.description: A 'Y' in this field indicates there are more payment schedules to be returned.

RepoEffDte.description: Will contain a value if there are more payment schedules to be returned.  To view the next set of payment schedules, resubmit the inquiry using the value returned here.

NbrRtn.description: The number of payment schedules returned.  Maximum of 50.

RepoTyp.description: Will contain a value if there are more payment schedules to be returned.  To view the next set of payment schedules, resubmit the inquiry using the value returned here.

LeadCmmtAmt.description: Current balance of the lead commitment.

PrtyNbr.description: If using an ascending or descending payment method and/or funding method, identifies the order in which draws and/or payments are applied.

FundingMeth.description:
Identifies the method used to distribute a draw made against the commitment.  
 A  Ascending by priority number.  
 D  Descending by priority number.  
 P  Pro rata.

NbrOfNoChanges.description: Number of related commitment participations that had no changes.

AcctNbr.description: Account number associated with lead commitment.

NbrPrtEntries.description: The function will tally all the related commitment participations that have either the commitment participation number filled in or the update indicator not equal to 'N.'

NbrOfDeletes.description: Number of related commitment participations that were deleted.

HiddenAcctNbr.description: Internal processing field.  Before running this PUT method, the user must first run the GET method; then copy the data returned in the corresponding GET field into this PUT field.

HiddenLeadCmmtNbr.description: Internal processing field.  Before running this PUT method, the user must first run the GET method; then copy the data returned in the corresponding GET field into this PUT field.

NbrOfChanges.description: Number of related commitment participations that had changes.

NbrOfAdds.description: Number of related commitment participations that were added.

PmtMeth.description:
Identifies the method for automatic distribution of payments to participations.  
 A  Ascending by priority number.  
 D  Descending by priority number.  
 P  Pro rata.

TotPartsAmt.description: The total amount of all related commitment participations.

LNBillTrlrPrpse.description:
Reserve or miscellaneous fee purpose.  Purpose of the reserve or fee as defined on the reserve record of the new note.  
 D  Dealer.  
 F  Fees.  
 I  Insurance.

LNBillTrlrBilledNotPd.description: Reserve or miscellaneous fee amount not paid.  Reserve or miscellaneous fee portion of the bill that has not been paid.

LNBillTrlrNbr.description: Reserve or miscellaneous fee number.  Identifies the reserve or fee.

LNBillTrlrBilledAmt.description: Reserve or miscellaneous fee amount.  Portion of the bill applied to reserves or miscellaneous fees.

LeadCmmtAmt.description: Current balance of the lead commitment.

PrtyNbr.description: If using an ascending or descending payment method and/or funding method, identifies the order in which draws and/or payments are applied.

FundingMeth.description:
Identifies the method used to distribute a draw made against the commitment.  
 A  Ascending by priority number.  
 D  Descending by priority number.  
 P  Pro rata.

AcctNbr.description: Account number associated with lead commitment.

NbrPrtEntries.description: The number of related commitment participations.

HiddenAcctNbr.description: Internal processing field.  To perform maintenance after this inquiry, copy the data returned here into the corresponding PUT input field.

HiddenLeadCmmtNbr.description: Internal processing field.  To perform maintenance after this inquiry, copy the data returned here into the corresponding PUT input field.

PmtMeth.description:
Identifies the method for automatic distribution of payments to participations.  
 A  Ascending by priority number.  
 D  Descending by priority number.  
 P  Pro rata.

TotPartsAmt.description: The total amount of all related commitment participations.

CBCLInd.description: Indicates whether the system is using the lesser of the commitment unused amount or the adjusted available amount when authorizing additional loans.  Y or N.

ZeroAvailInd.description: Indicates whether or not this individual commitment is using the zero available feature.  Y or N.

LNRvlvgInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is revolving.

LNAvailAmt.description: Amount of the commitment balance currently available to the borrower.

LNCollCde.description: User-defined code intended to identify the collateral securing a commitment.

LNAutoDrawDelinquencyInd.description: For revolving credit notes, determines whether the draw indicator is automatically set to N when a bill remains unpaid for the number of days specified in LN Auto Draw Delinquency Days.  May default from Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNOvrideInd.description:
Determines whether the system changes the current amount of the commitment to zero or continues to process the commitment as usual.  This field is active only when the commitment status indicator is changed to P (paid).  
 Y  Continue processing commitment as usual.  
 Z  Change the current amount of the commitment to zero.

LNImmdPrnCmmtNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the number of the parent commitment.  For a stand-alone commitment, the number of the commitment itself.

LNExpDte.description: Indicates the date the commitment expires.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNApprovalDte.description: Effective date of the commitment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNUltPrnAcctNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the account of the commitment at the top of the hierarchy.  For a stand-alone commitment, the account of the commitment itself.

LNRepayConvDte.description: Identifies the date the line of credit draw period ends for an ALC product and will be used by the system as the date event to trigger the repayment auto conversion process.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNFedCallCde.description: Identifies the loan classification for federal call report purposes, as defined on Classification Segment 415 of Bank Control.

LNOrigTermInd.description:
Represents the length of time between the approval date and the expiration date. 
D  No expiration date indicated.  
  R  Term is 13 months or more.  
 T  Term is 12 months or less.

LNDesc.description: User-entered description which overrides the commitment description set on Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNCmmtRvwDte.description: Date the commitment is due for review.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNOvheadTypCde.description: User-defined code intended to indicate the method of calculating overhead costs during profitability analysis.  May default from Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNUltPrnCmmtNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the number of the commitment at the top of the hierarchy.  For a stand-alone commitment, the number of the commitment itself.

LNTerm.description: Term of the commitment expressed in months.

LNPartCde.description:
Indicates the participation status of the commitment.  
 B  Bought; commitment purchased from another financial institution.  
 N  Not a commitment participation.

LNUsedAmt.description: Total outstanding draws made against the commitment.

LNDrawInd.description: Determines whether a draw can be made against a commitment.  For revolving credit notes with an automatic draw delinquency indicator of Y, may reset to N when a bill remains unpaid for the number of days specified in LN Auto Draw Delinquency Days.

LNAutoDrawDelinquencyDay.description: For revolving credit notes, the number of days after the bill due date that the draw indicator is set to N if the bill remains unpaid, preventing additional draws against the commitment.  May default from Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNAdvisementLvl.description:
Indicates whether the customer is aware of the commitment and, if so, whether the commitment is an informal or legal agreement. 
 A  Advised.  Customer is aware of the agreement by way of informal verbal or written notice.  
 B - F  User-defined.  
 G  Guidance.  Commitment is established for internal purposes; customer is not aware of its existence.  
 H - K  User-defined.  
 L  Legal.  A binding legal document exists between the financial institution and the customer.  
 M - T  User-defined.  
 U  Under review.  Customer is aware of the agreement by way of informal verbal or written notice.  
 V - Z  User-defined.

LNSecuredInd.description:
Indicates whether the commitment is secured by collateral on the Collateral System.  
 B  Secured, but collateral not on Collateral System.  
 N  Not secured.  
 Y  Secured with collateral on the Collateral System.

LNRepayProf.description: Identifies the repayment profile associated with this commitment, as defined on Repay Auto Conversion Segment 426 of Bank Control.   May only be entered if LN ALC Indicator field is Y (yes).

LNCmmtTyp.description: Represents a set of commitment options and defaults, as defined on Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNRnwlDte.description: Indicates the date the commitment was renewed.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.  Date cannot be later than the commitment expiration date.

OrigCmmtAmt.description: Amount for which the commitment was originally established.

LNUnusedAmt.description: Difference between the current commitment amount and the commitment used amount.

LNPndInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is pending, causing any usage to create an exception condition.

LNPrcPln.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.

LNBrnchNbr.description: Branch number of the bank at which the loan is established.

LNParticipatingBnkNbr.description: For commitments with a participation status indicator of B, identifies the bank involved in the participation, as indicated in the company record established on Company Basic Maintenance (LNCBM).

LNCollPct.description: Percentage of collateral required on the  unused portion of the commitment.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNRdcAvail.description: Indicates whether the commitment amount immediately reduces the available balance on the parent commitment.  Reduced availability is not allowed for TLC or ultimate parent commitments.  Y or N.

LNTxnCde.description: Identifies the transaction being performed.

LNEffDte.description: Date the transaction takes effect.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNPCMAInd.description: Indicates whether the account is part of a Personal Cash Management relationship.  Y or N.

LNLstRiskRtg.description: System-generated date indicating the last change to the risk rating code.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNUsrCde1.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNUsrCde4.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNUsrCde5.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNUsrCde2.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNUsrCde3.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNTakedownDte.description: For a stand-alone commitment, date the commitment should be taken down to zero if not used.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNActvStatCde.description: With the exception of the assigned value of P for paid, represents a user-defined code intended to indicate the status of a commitment.  A value of P automatically resets the draw indicator to N.

TLCCommitInd.description: Indicates whether commitment is part of a TLC relationship.  Y or N.

LNRiskRtg.description: User-defined code intended to identify the collection risk associated with the commitment.

LNAcctNme.description: Identifies the owner of the account on inquiries and reports.  Tip:  Because many reports sort alphabetically by the account name, we suggest putting the last name first.  If you are setting up a joint account, the name can include both first names  (e.g., Smith, John & Mary).

LNALCInd.description: Indicates whether this commitment is part of an account line of credit (ALC) structure.  Y or N.

LNCurAmt.description: Current approved amount of the commitment.

LNPurgeInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is flagged for purging.

LNImmdPrnAcctNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the account of the parent commitment.  For a stand-alone commitment, the account of the commitment itself.

LNExpDteInd.description:
Indicates whether the available balance that is interfaced to the general ledger is reduced to zero when the commitment expires.  
Y (Yes) - Reduce the commitment available balance that is interfaced to general ledger to zero (0.00) when the commitment expires. 
B (Both) - Reduce the commitment available and the commitment unused balances that are interfaced to general ledger to zero (0.00) when the commitment expires. 
N (Neither) - Do not reduce commitment available and commitment unused balances that are interfaced to general ledger to zero (0.00) when the commitment expires.

LNDteIntPdTo.description: Date interest is paid to on the loan.  If left blank, it will default to one of the following values:  Bill Type A:  Date of the bill that was satisfied. Bill Type B:  Date of the last bill segment satisfied.  Bill Type C:  Effective date of the transaction.  On Bill Type B and C loans, if left blank and a partial payment or overage was made, the system will calculate the appropriate date.

LNTotTxnAmt.description: Total amount applied by the transaction including any amount from deferred interest or buydown account.

LNDlrResrvAmt.description: Amount applied to accruing dealer reserves.

LNPmtMethInd.description:
Indicates how the payment should be spread to participants.  
 A  Ascending sequential.  
 D  Descending sequential. 
 P  Prorata.

LNRmvlCde.description:
For investor-sold loans, identifies the reason for liquidation for FHLMC(1), FNMA(2), and GNMA(3) reporting.  
 60  Payoff; due to maturity (1, 2, 3).  
 61  Payoff; mortgage prepaid (1).  
 63  FHA refinance (HUD); mortgage prepaid (1, 2).  
 65  Payoff; mortgage repurchased (1, 2, 3).  
 66  Payoff; mortgage converted from an ARM to fixed rate (1).  
 70  Liquidated held for sale or foreclosure (2, 3); transfer to REO (1).  
 71  Liquidated third party sale or foreclosure (1, 2). 
 72  Liquidated pending conveyance (2); FHA/VA foreclosure (2).  
 73  FHA/VA foreclosure sale (1).  
 165  Repurchase-assumed (1); Report Type 4.  
 265  Repurchase-recourse (1); Report Type 4.  
 365  Repurchase-substitution (2, 3).

LNDelinquencyOvride.description:
For Bill Type A, indicates whether to allow a payment to post that would otherwise reject based on fields on Bank Control Note Option Segment 410. 
 Y  Override the REJECT PAYMENT DELINQUENCY DAYS field.  
 B  Override the REJECT CURTAILMENT DAYS field or the REJECT PAYMENT DELINQUENCY DAYS field.

LNAccrAdjmt.description: Accrual adjustment amount. This field is used for the amount when the payment indicator is 'INT' and the transaction code is '677', '725', '697', '735'.

LNAcctOldTotOwed.description: Bank's share of the total owed on the account before the payment was applied.

LNIntDuePortionOfBill.description: Interest due portion of the bill before the payment is applied.

LNOrigPostingDte.description: For Bill Type A loans, the backdated posting date.  Applies only to Tran Codes 610-617.

LNOthFeeAmt.description: Amount applied to loan fees other than late charges.

LNResrvOrEscrNbr.description: Reserve number for special payments to insurance or dealer reserves (if using INS or DLR in the szLNPmtInd field) or escrow number to which refund should be applied.

LNOvrShrtAmt.description: Amount over or short of the actual payoff figure. This field is only for transactions that pay off the loan.

LNAutoCkInd.description: Indicates whether the system should produce a check, assuming your institution has completed the  check printing setup procedures.  Valid only for Tran Codes 720-724, 726, 728, and 729 to BUY, ESC, ESR, or UNA. Y or N.

LNIntAmt.description: Total amount applied to interest accrual.  This includes any interest paid from a buydown account or deferred as principal.

LNUnapldFundsAmt.description: Amount applied to increase or decrease unapplied funds.

LNBuydwnAmt.description: Amount taken from the buydown account and applied as interest.

LNCapitalizeInptCde.description:
Capitalize accrued interest, capitalize input interest, or regular special adjustment for any valid Loan Category E loan.  
 A Capitalize accrued interest.  
 I  Capitalize input government interest.  
 N  Regular special adjustment.

LNLendingLmtOvride.description: Indicates whether to override the bank lending dollar limit established on Bank Control Processing Option Segment 400. This field cannot be overridden unless the system has generated a message indicating a transaction will force the loan to exceed the bank lending limit.

LNBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple loan payments into one total.

LNPrinDuePortionOfBill.description: Principal due portion of the bill before the payment is applied.

LNLNPrevBal.description: Loan balance before the payment was applied.

LNCkPye.description: Determines the payee of the check produced by this transaction.  A valid escrow company number overrides C (customer) which is the default value.

LNNbrPrts.description: Number of participation payments made as part of this transaction.

LNAutoCHOFNonaccrualAdjmt.description: Indicates whether a special adjustment transaction (Tran Code 677 or 725) will be passed to the bank side for a non-accrual or charge-off transaction.

LNInsResrvAmt.description: Amount applied to accruing insurance reserves.

LNShrtNme.description: Short name of the account to which the transaction was applied.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNEscrResrvAmt.description: Amount applied to escrow reserve balance.

LNPmtInd.description:
Category to which the payment or debit should be applied.  
 BAL  Loan balance.  
 INT  Interest.  
 INS  Insurance reserve.  
 DLR  Dealer reserve.  
 LCG  Late charge. 
 BUY  Buydown amount.  
 UNA  Unapplied funds (only for Bill Type A loans).  
 ESC  Regular escrow.  
 ESR  Escrow reserve.  
 ESU  Escrow refund; subtracts from escrow disbursed  year-to-date amount of the escrow segment shown on RES/ESC NUMBER field.  
 COF  Cost of funds accrual adjustment.

LNAcctNewTotOwed.description: Bank's share of the total owed on the account after the payment was applied.

LNEscrAmt.description: Amount applied to regular escrow balance.

LNTxnCde.description:
Type of monetary transaction.  For a complete list of tran codes, see the Appendix of the Loan System Manual.  
 610, 612-617, 621, 623-629  Regular loan payment.  
 611  Regular loan renewal payment.  
 620  Regular loan payment (will not mark loan paid off).  
 650, 652-658  Regular loan payoff.  
 651  Regular renewal payoff.  
 660, 662-666  Special loan payment.

LNPrinAmt.description: Total amount applied to the principal balance.

LNOverpaymentInd.description:
For bill-cycled loans, indicates where to apply amount that is overpaid.  
 B  Back of loan.  
 F  Front of loan.

LNPartSpreadOvride.description: Indicates whether to override the automatic participation spread field on the loan when that field is Y, indicating the system automatically distributes principal and interest portions of a payment to any associated participations.  A 'Y' in this field prevents automatic distributions.

LNBillMaintInd.description:
Allows you to process the bill maintenance along with the payment, or process a post-maturity bill payment by itself.  
 Y   Perform bill maintenance at the same time the payment is processed.  
 P  Perform a post-maturity bill payment.

LNDferIntAmt.description: Amount of interest paid by increasing the principal balance.

LNPstNoTxnOvride.description:
For any bill type, indicates whether to allow a payment to post that would otherwise reject, or whether to allow an escrow payment to a paid loan. 
 Y  Post the transaction despite the value of the post no transaction field.  
 P  Post an escrow payment despite a paid indicator value of P, M, or C.

LNLNNewBal.description: New loan balance after the payment is applied.

LNParticipantIntEffDte.description: Date for calculating the participant interest payment portion.  Today's date is default for payment date-to-payment date loans (Bill Type C); bill due date is default for Bill Types A and B.

ChgFrequecyInd.description:
Determines when the rate on the participation changes in relation to when the index changes. Defaults to zero, indicating participation rate is not tied to an index.
 
 D On a specific day of the month in which the index changes. If the specific day is a nonworking day, the change occurs on the next working day.
 L On the last work day of the month in which the index changes.
 N On the next work day following the index change.
 2 On the first work day of the month following the index change.
 3 On the first work day of the quarter following the index change.
 0 On the day of an index change.
 R On the day following an index change.
 M On the Monday after an index change.
 T On the Tuesday after an index change.
 W On the Wednesday after an index change.
 H On the Thursday after an index change.
 F On the Friday after an index change.
 1 On the first day of the month following an index change.
 *E Monthly following an index change.
 *Q Quarterly following an index change.
 *S Semiannually following an index change.
 *A Annually if a change to the index occurred during the year.
 *Z On next change date when change in index occurs; next change date does not automatically cycle.
 *K To be changed manually when change in index occurs; does not cycle on next change date.
 V Based on the variable plan setup.
 C For notes/participations tied to a variable plan, rate change based on original index and original interest rate.
 
 *If the rate change date is left blank when using frequencies of E, Q, S or A, the system assumes the change date to be last day of calendar frequency.

SplitRteTypInd.description:
Indicates the type of rate structure for all rate levels associated with the rate plan, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.
 
 B Bracketed; participations accrue at a single rate for the entire balance of the participation.
 T Tiered; participations accrue at multiple rates for various balance portions.

SldDte.description: Date the investor/participant purchased the loan for informational purposes.  Format YYYY-MM-DD.

EscrInd.description:
Indicates the participant is holding the escrows for this note. Can only be on one participation per note.
 
 E  Escrow balance only
 R  Reserve balance only
 Y  Both escrow and reserve balances
 N  Neither balance
 
 Defaults to the value set on the investor plan for investor participations. If this flag is not set at new participation time, the following note-level keywords must be completed:
 
 LNNESCPT Participating bank number
 LNNESPLN Investor plan number, if applicable
 LNNESCPS Participating sequence number
 LNNESGPN Investor pool number, if applicable
 LNNESRIN Reserve indicator

ReqrMrgn.description: For investor participations, the required margin for FNMA when ARM loans have a rate change. It is the rate to be added to the index to determine the uncapped pass-through rate. Defaults from the pool.

PrcPlnNbr.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.

InvstrServFeeBase.description:
Indicates how the service fee is calculated. For investor participations, defaults from the investor plan.
 
 1 Service fee rate is applied to the total payment.
 2 Service fee rate is applied to the principal and interest amount.
 3 Service fee rate is applied to the unpaid principal balance.
 4 Service fee rate is applied to the interest amount. For investor participations, required for all investor IDs except O (other).
 5 Fixed dollar amount, as specified in the Investor Service Fee Amount field.

InvstrServFeeRte.description: Service fee rate if an Investor Service Fee Base of 1 through 4 is used. For investor participations, defaults from investor pool.

RptSBAInd.description: Determines whether the participation is used in the calculations for Colson services.  Y or N (default).

UseNoteRteInd.description:
Indicates whether the participation rate information should be taken from the note segment instead of being entered here.  For investor participations and participations that are tied to a variable plan.
 
 Y  Use note rate.
 N  Do not use note rate.  Default.

InvstrPoolNbr.description: Identifies the pool through which the loan is being sold to the investor, as defined on the Investor Pool Information screen

RteLmt.description: For split-rate or rate plan loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the Loan Rate 2; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the Loan Rate 1.

CnfrmPrtNme.description: The name of the investor or participating bank to which the loan is being sold.

ExcsYldInd.description:
Indicates whether excess yield applies and if it should be recalculated.
 
 F Applicable; rate is fixed; do not recalculate.
 V Applicable; rate is variable.
 N Not applicable.

GuarFeeRte.description:
Guaranty fee rate for the participated loan. Defaults from the pool. Used to calculate the weighted average guaranty fee rate (WAGF) of all loans in the pool. Enter as a percent. For example enter 1% as 1.0.
 
 Note:  For FNMA Laser III scheduled/scheduled pools (Report Type 11), the WAGF is used to calculate fees due if the guaranty fee rate on the pool record is zero.

Mrgn2.description: For split-rate or rate plan loans, the numeric relation to the index, expressed as points or a percentage.

IssDte.description:
Date interest begins to accrue.
 
 Tip:  For Bill Type A loans that are being sold to an investor, we recommend that the issue date be one month prior to the next (or first) bill due date and that the bill due date be the first of the month.  Format YYYY-MM-DD.

Mrgn1.description: For floating rate, the numeric relation to the index rate, expressed as points or a percentage. Also used for variable split-rate loans.

GuarFeeInd.description:
Identifies the type of guaranty fee for the participated loan. Defaults from the pool.
 
 R Regular guaranty fee.
 S Special guaranty fee.

Celng1.description: For floating rate, the highest rate at which the participation can accrue. Also used for variable split-rate loans.

Celng2.description: For split-rate or rate plan loans, the highest rate at which the note can accrue on balances over the split-rate limit. Default is 999.999999.

CmmtNbr.description: Identifies the commitment related to the participation.

InvstrLNNbr.description: Investor- or participant-assigned loan identification number.

InvstrRte.description: For participations sold to FNMA, pass-through rate. For participations sold to FHLMC, net yield rate.

Indx.description: Identifies the index to which the participation is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

AutoRevrsRepostInd.description: Indicates whether the system should automatically reverse payments to allow a new participation to post and then repost the payments to the note and the participation if the auto participation flag is Y.  Y or N.

TimesRenewed.description: Number of times the participation has been renewed.

PrtPercentage.description:
Percent of the principal balance that is being participated.  If not entered, the principal distribution to the participation is calculated as:
 
 participation current balance / loan current balance
 
 This field must be entered for Bill Type A loans being sold to an investor.
 
 Note:  This field will allow only whole numbers in the PCT (percent sold) field for loans sold to investors with an investor ID of F (FNMA) or M (FHLMC).

Flr1.description: For floating rate, the lowest rate at which the participation can accrue. Also used for variable split-rate loans.

Flr2.description: For split-rate or rate plan loans, the lowest rate at which the note can accrue on balances over the split-rate limit.

NxtChgDte.description: Identifies a specified date on which the rate changes following an index change for participations with frequencies of E, Q, S, A, Z or K. When rate change date is reached, the date is automatically cycled ahead according to the frequency for frequencies of E, Q, S or A. For frequencies of Z and K, rate change date must be manually maintained.  Format YYYY-MM-DD.

InvstrServFeeAmt.description: Dollar amount of the service fee if an Investor Service Fee Base of 5  is used. For investor participations, defaults from investor pool.

PrtNbr.description: Identifies the bank to which the loan is being sold, as defined on the Company Basic Maintenance screen (LNCBM).

UnapldFundsInd.description:
Indicates if this participant is holding the unapplied funds for this note.  Y or N.  
 
 If this flag is not set at new participation time, the following note-level keywords must be completed:
 
 LNNUFPRT Participating bank number
 LNNUFSEQ Participating sequence number
 LNNUNPLN Investor plan number, if applicable
 LNNUNGPN Investor pool number, if applicable

BuydwnInd.description:
Indicates whether any buydown information should be reported for this participation.
 
 Y Part is named on the note as holding the buydown amount.
 
 If this flag is not set at new participation time, the following note-level keywords must be completed:
 
 LNNBYPRT Participating bank number
 LNNBYSEQ Participating sequence number
 LNNBYPLN Investor plan number, if applicable
 LNNBYGPN Investor pool number, if applicable

Basis.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.
 
 0 Actual-day month/360-day year.
 3 30-day month/360-day year.
 5 Actual-day month/365-day year.
 7 Actual-day month/actual-day year.
 9 30-day month/365-day year.

ExcsYld.description:
Excess yield rate.  Calculated as follows:
 
 participation rate - service fee rate - investor rate
 
 For investor participations, field not used.

UsrDte.description: User-defined date to be used in conjunction with User Codes 1-5.  Format YYYY-MM-DD.

NoteHldrInd.description:
Indicates where the physical note is held.
 
 I Investor.
 S Servicer.
 T Third party.

ParValInd.description: Indicates whether note was sold at par value.  Y or N.

SaleTypInd.description:
Indicates the type of sale for FHLBB reporting.
 
 1 Mortgage-backed security.  
 2 Cash.
 3-9, A-Z Other values for FHLBB reporting.

OrigBal.description: Amount of the loan initially being sold.

ErrInd.description:
Additional error information.
 
 N  No error.
 Y  Error found.
 V  Error during auto reversal.
 P  Error during auto reapply.
 D  Error found and auto reversals have been completed.

OverlineInd.description: Indicates whether the participation was sold because the note is over your bank�s legal lending limit.  Y or N.

RltOfMrgn1.description: For floating rate, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, -, or %). Also used for variable split-rate loans.

RltOfMrgn2.description: For split-rate or rate plan loans, the relationship of the Margin 2 to the index (+, -, or %).

PrtSeqNbr.description: Identifies the participation when the same participating bank has multiple participations for a note. Defaults to 001.

InvstrPlnNbr.description: Number the investor uses to identify a group of loans, as defined on the Investor Plan Information screen

LNRte1.description:
For loans with a fixed rate, the rate at which the loan accrues interest. For split-rate or rate plan loans, the accrual rate on any balance up to and including the split rate limit. For example, 9-1/2% = 009.500000. Not used for floating rates.
 
 Tip:  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

FhlmcFundingDte.description: For investor participations, actual date that the loan was sold to FHLMC. This is the FHLMC settlement date reflected on the Loan Purchase Statement, FHLMC Form 15.

LNRte2.description: For split-rate or rate plan loans, the accrual rate on any balance over the split rate limit.

PmtPrtyNbr.description: Identifies the order for automatic payment distributions among the lead bank and other participations when a sequential payment method is used.

RtePlnNbr.description: Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the participation is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.

NewRteOver.description: The rate over, after this transaction.

RateUnderMargin.description: For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.

Index.description: Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

PricePlan.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

NxtRteChgDte.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RtePln.description: Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered.

Basis.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year.

RteChgFreq.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.

RateUnderRelInd.description: Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %).

SeqNbr.description: Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date.

EffDte.description: Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

OldExcesYld.description: The excess yield, before this transaction.

LNCategory.description:
Identifies the loan category for account-level rate changes (Rate Indicator is A).  Rate change will be applied only to notes of this category.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 R  Revolving credit.  
 S  Specific accounts receivable.

RateCap.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change.

OldRteUnder.description: The rate under, before this transaction.

RateOverMargin.description: For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

RateOverRelInd.description: Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

NewRteUnder.description: The rate under, after this transaction.

SplitLimitAmt.description: Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under.

RelDte.description: Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RateUnder.description: For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.

OldRteOver.description: The rate over, before this transaction.

NewExcessYld.description: The excess yield, after this transaction.

RateOver.description: For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

CatFltr.description: Indicates which category of memos to return.  If this field is left blank, the system returns all memos associated with the account or note regardless of the memo�s category.

MoreInd.description: A 'Y' in this field indicates there are more memos to be returned.

AcctNbr.description: Appropriate account number from the application account database.

RepoMemoNbr.description: For requests to retrieve additional memos, this value is required.  This value will be returned to indicate the starting point of the next inquiry.

RecordLmt.description: This is the number of memos to be returned, up to the maxium of 25.

TypeFilter.description:
Indicates which type of memos to be returned.  If this field is left blank, the system returns all memos tied to the account regardless of the memo�s type. 
 S  Predefined.  
 U  User-defined.

NoteNbr.description: Loan System note number.  Must be entered if the memo is related to the note.

zTrackFltr.description: If this field and the Account Number and Note Number fields are completed, the system displays all memos associated with the note and track code.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNRltCmmtUsgAcctNbr.description: Account number of the associated usage.

LNUsgMatDte.description: For usage type B or L, the maturity date.

LNAcctNme.description: The name associated with the account.

LNUsgTypCde.description:
Identifies the type of usage linked to the commitment.  
 B  Banker's Acceptance  
 L  Letter of Credit  
 N  Note  
 R  Revolving Credit

LNLendingLmtOvride.description: For usages exceeding the bank lending limit established on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control, indicates whether the lending limit is to be overridden.  Y or N.

LNUsgAmt.description: For usage type B or L, the dollar amount of the usage.

LNEscrRte.description: Escrow interest rate.  Defaults to the rate on the Company Category Maintenance screen (LNCCM) if LN Escrow Type is I.

LNActvInactvInd.description: Any value other than zero indicates the escrow is inactive.  Code can be user-defined to indicate the reason for an inactive escrow.  0 = Active.

LNPndFhaAnvrsyMth.description: Month/year when the final (12th) portion of next year's premium will be remitted.  System-calculated in the 11th month for RBP escrows, and is 12 months later than the current anniversary date.  Represented as MMCCYY.  Default is zeroes.

LNNxtDisbDte.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1 or 2.

LNUsrCde.description: User-defined code to further identify an escrow segment.

LNCustRcpntCde.description:
Indicates whether the borrower or the company payee receives escrow disbursements.  Default is 0 (zero) if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 2 (noncollected).  
 C  Customer (borrower).  
 P  Payee (taxing authority or insurance company, for example).   
 0  Not applicable.

LNTrtsAddsTxnInd.description:
TRTS (TICOR) ADDS transaction indicator.  
 1  Delete.  
 2  Add.  
 3  Change.  
 Automatically set to 2 at new note time if the following applies:  The Automated Escrow Billing Indicator on page 2 of Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is Y; the  Customer Number on page 2 of Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is greater than zero; the Company Purpose Code is E (escrow); and the Tape Processing Agency Number is 17 (First American Real Estate Tax Service--FARETS).  Reset to spaces after ADDS tape for this period is produced.  Can be manually entered; must be manually entered for Values 1 and 3.

LNR7360Ind.description:
Indicates whether a request for a bill or a receipt is printed on the Tax Bill Request Notice (R-7360).  
 B  Bill.  
 R  Receipt.  
 N  Not applicable; no notice is produced.  
 When you set up a new note, the existing company field, R-7360 Default, provides  the following default functions:   If the R-7360 Default field is 0 (N/A) or P (Payee), the LN R-7360 Request Print Indicator note field defaults to N.  If the R-7360 Default field is C (Customer), the LN R-7360  Request Print Indicator note field defaults as follows:  For regular escrows (LN Escrow Collection Method 1), default is B.  For noncollected escrows (LN Escrow Collection Method 2), default is R.  For reserve escrows (LN Escrow Collection Method 3), default is N.

LNCkRcpnt.description:
For automatic disbursements.  Note:  If this field is not properly filled, escrow checks will not be produced.  
 C  Customer.  
 P  Payee (company).  
 B  Both customer and payee.  
 N  No check; paid list.  
 G  No check; paid list  is printed in group number order.  
 L  List disbursement; one check per company payee.  
 S  Set disbursement; one check per group per company payee.

LNDisbMeth.description:
Determines the disbursement amount for automatic and mass disbursements.  Can default from the payee's company record.  
 A  Current escrow balance.  
 B  Projected disbursement until end-of-year.  
 C  Amount to disbursement date (include delinquents).  
 D   Next expected disbursement amount.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNInsCoverAmt.description: Amount of coverage allowed by insurance policy.  For RBP escrows, is required and is equal to the original  mortgage amount less financed points and up-front premiums.  Can also apply to FHA or PMI insurance escrows.

LNNxtDisbAmt.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1.

LNCurFhaAnvrsyMth.description: Current payment anniversary date.  Month/year when the final (12th) payment of the current year's FHA or RBP premium will be remitted.  This date is later than the issue date, but sooner than the maturity date.  Represented as MMCCYY.  Default is zeroes.

LNDisbExcpInd.description:
Indicates whether automatic disbursement is allowed.  
 Y  Yes.  
 N  No.  
 X  Do not allow any disbursements.

LNNbrOfInstallments.description: Number of installments, from one through four, to make per year for the escrow.  Applies only if the LN Disbursement Frequency is 9 and/or the LN Even Amount Escrow Disbursement Indicator is N.

LNTrtsHitCde.description: TRTS (TICOR) hit code.  Automatically updated with TRTS update tape.  Can be manually entered.

LNPyeNbr.description: Payee to whom the escrow will be disbursed as defined on the company database.

LNInsExpDte.description: For insurance escrows, the policy's expiration date.

LNLstDisbDte.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1 or 2.

LNColMeth.description:
Escrow collection method.  
 1  Fixed dollar amount collected as part of the payment (regular escrows).  
 2  Noncollected (memo).  
 3  Held; collected up front; special assessment (used for reserve escrows).

LNCoSubcategory.description: Subcategory number defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

LNAutoDisbStat.description:
Indicates whether an escrow disbursement can be made; used with LN Automatic Disbursement Indicator of 3 or 9.  
 A  Not ready to disburse.  
 B  Ready to disburse.

LNDisbFreq.description:
Indicates how often the escrow is disbursed.  If the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 3, this field must be 9.  
 0  Unknown or not available.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 9  Other.

LNPremCalcMeth.description:
Premium calculation method used for RBP escrows.  
 SC  Straight calculation.  
 AS  Amortization schedule factor tables.  
 PF  Premium factor tables.

LNEscrIntInd.description: Indicates whether escrow interest is paid upon escrow disbursement.  Y or N.  Applicable only if the Interest Disbursement Frequency value on Escrow Interest Plan Segment 465 of Bank Control is 5 or 6.

LNEvenInstltInd.description: If there is more than one escrow disbursement per year, this field indicates whether all disbursements are the same or at least one is different.  Y or N.

LNEscrTyp.description:
Escrow type.  
 F  FHA.  
 I  Insurance.  
 O  Other.  
 P  PMI.  
 R  RBP (FHA risk-based premium).  
 T  Tax.

LNTrtsCntrtSfx.description: TRTS (TICOR) contract suffix.  Automatically updated with TRTS update tape.  Can be manually entered.

LNYTDDistAmt.description: For FHA escrows, this is the anniversary year-to-date amount.  For all other escrows, this is the calendar year-to-date amount.

LNTaxInsIdentificationMaintCde.description:
Escrow ID maintenance code.  
 Blank  Inquire.  
 A  Add.  
 C  Change.  
 D  Delete.

LNCkGrpNbr.description: User-defined number for automatic disbursements with a LN Escrow Check Recipient value of G (no check; paid list by group) or S (set check).

LNPndPrem.description: Annual premium amount for the next FHA anniversary year for FHA escrows.  System-calculated in the 11th month for RBP escrows.

LNAutoDisbInd.description:
Determines the disbursement method.  Can default from the payee's company record.  
 0  No automatic disbursements, but mass and individual disbursements are allowed.  
 1  Automatic, one-time disbursement on the specified next expected disbursement date.   
 2  Fully automatic disbursements occur according to the next expected disbursement date and the number of lead days.  
 3  Automatic disbursements like Option 2, but disbursements will only occur when you set the disbursement status to B (ready to disburse).  
 9  Mass disbursement allowed when the disbursement status is B (ready to disburse).

LNAutoDisbLeadDay.description: Number of days before the next disbursement date that an automatic disbursement is generated.

LNTaxInsIdentificationNbr.description: Line number for the tax ID or policy number.  Values are 01 through 99 or system-assigned beginning with 01.

PriorYTDDisb.description: Prior year-to-date disbursed amounts for all escrow types.

LNCoCat.description: Three-character user-defined category code defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control, such as TAX or INS.

LNLstDisbAmt.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1.

Zip.description: The elementized ZIP Code of the collateral address.

CityLine.description: The collateral city, state, and ZIP code information.

Percentage.description: System-calculated percentage of the dollar amount in a collateral record to the total dollar amount of all multiple collateral.

ItmLstUpdtUsrId.description: ID of the last user who updated this collateral records Consists of the first character and last 3 characters of the user ID.

CollCat.description:
The collateral category value assigned to the Multiple Collateral record.  
 AG  Agriculture  
 AS  Assignment  
 CE  Commercial Real Estate  
 EQ  Equipment  
 FI  Financial Instruments  
 MS  Miscellaneous  
 RE  Residential Real Estate
 SE  Securities  
 TR  Transportation  
 UC  UCC

ItmLstUpdtDte.description: Date a user last updated this collateral record.

Amt.description: User-defined dollar amount of the collateral for this collateral record.

PrimaryInd.description: Indicates whether this collateral is the primary collateral associated with the note.  Y or N.

Fraction.description: The elementized house number fraction of the collateral address.

City.description: The elementized city of the collateral address.

HouseNbr.description: The elementized house number of the collateral address.

TypCde.description: User-defined value that identifies the type of collateral.

Direction.description: The elementized direction of the collateral address.

SpecialStr.description: The elementized additional street information of the collateral address.

MSANumber.description: The MSA number of the collateral.

Desc.description: User-defined description of the collateral information in the record.
