Dte.description: User-defined date of the individual collateral record.

SupplmLine.description: The collateral supplemental street address information.

State.description: The elementized state of the collateral address.

StreetNme.description: The elementized street name of the collateral address.

LNEscCustRcpntCde.description:
Identifies who receives an escrow disbursement.  
 C  Customer; borrower.  
 P  Payee; insurance company; municipality.

LNEscCurFhaAnvrsyMth.description: Represented as MMCCYY, indicates when the 12th and final monthly payment of the FHA or RBP premium for the current year is remitted.

LNEscEscrRte.description: Identifies the rate of the insurance premium.

LNEscDisbExcpInd.description:
Indicates whether escrow disbursements are allowed.  
 Y  All disbursements allowed.  
 N  Individual disbursements allowed; no mass or automatic disbursements allowed.  
 X  No disbursements allowed.

LNEscColMeth.description:
Identifies the collection method for the escrow.  
 1  Fixed dollar amount collected as part of the payment; regular escrow.  
 2  Noncollected; memo.  
 3  Reserve escrow held; collected up front; special assessment.

LNEscTaxInsIdentificationNbr1.description: For insurance escrows (Escrow Types I or P), this field contains an insurance policy number.  For tax escrows (Escrow Type T), this field contains the first of up to five property tax identification numbers.

LNEscPyeNbr.description: Identifies the company receiving the escrow disbursement for the note, as defined on the Company Basic Maintenance screen (LNCBM).

LNEscDisbMeth.description:
For mass and automatic escrow disbursements, determines method of disbursement.  Defaults to the company level information.  
 A  Escrow balance as of the report/posting date; does not include delinquent payments.  
 B  Escrow balance projected to the end  of the year; assumes all payments are current.  
 C  Escrow balance as of disbursement effective date; assumes all payments are current; does not back out paid-ahead segments.  
 D  Next expected disbursement amount.

LNEscTaxInsIdentificationNbr4.description: See business description for LN Escrow Tax/Insurance Identification Number 1.

LNEscCkRcpnt.description:
For mass and automatic escrow disbursements, determines where the escrow check is sent.  Defaults to the company level information.  
 B  Company and customer.  
 C  Customer.  
 G  No check; paid list printed in group number order.  
 L  List check; one check per company.  
 N  No check; paid list only.  
 P  Company.  
 S  Set check; one check per group per company.

LNEscTaxInsIdentificationNbr5.description: See business description for LN Escrow Tax/Insurance Identification Number 1.

LNEscTaxInsIdentificationNbr2.description: See business description for LN Escrow Tax/Insurance Identification Number 1.

LNEscTaxInsIdentificationNbr3.description: See business description for LN Escrow Tax/Insurance Identification Number 1.

LNEscEvenInstallmentsInd.description:
For loans with a disbursement frequency of 9 (other), indicates whether all disbursements are the same amount.  
 Y  Same amounts.  
 N  Different amounts.

LNEscUsrCde.description: User-defined field intended to identify an escrow segment.

LNEscNxtExpdDisbDte.description: For escrow collection methods 1 or 2, date of the next expected escrow disbursement.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNEscEscrIntInd.description: Indicates whether interest on the escrow is paid when the escrow is disbursed.  Y or N.

LNEscAutoDisbStat.description:
For notes with an automatic disbursement indicator of 3 or 9, indicates whether escrows are ready for automatic disbursements.  
 A  Not ready.  
 B  Ready.

LNEscEscrTyp.description:
Indicates the type of escrow.  
 F  FHA.  
 I  Insurance escrow.  
 O  Other.  
 P  PMI escrow.  
 R  RBP; FHA risk-based premiums.  
 T  Tax escrow.

LNEscR7360Ind.description:
Indicates whether a bill or receipt request is printed when a Tax Bill Request Notice (R-7360) is produced.  
 B  Bill request.  
 R  Receipt request.  
 N  No notice is produced.  
 
 If the bill request is sent to the payee or is not applicable, defaults to N.  
 
 If the bill request is sent to the customer, then:  For regular escrows (Escrow Collection Method 1), defaults to B.  For noncollected escrows (Escrow Collection Method 2), defaults to R.  For reserve escrows (Escrow Collection Method 3), defaults to N.

LNEscPremCalcMeth.description:
For RBP escrows, identifies the premium calculation method.  
 AS  Amortization schedule factor tables.  
 PF  Premium factor tables.  
 SC  Straight calculation.

LNEscInsCoverAmt.description: Identifies the amount of insurance coverage.  For RBP escrows, the original loan balance less financed points and up-front premiums.

LNEscInstlt1DisbDte.description: Expected disbursement date for the first escrow installment.  Format:  MMDD where M is month and D is date.

LNEscCurPrem.description: Indicates the amount of the annual escrow premium.

LNEscNxtExpdDisbAmt.description: For escrow collection methods 1 or 2, amount of the next expected escrow disbursement.

LNEscAutoDisbLeadDay.description: For notes with an automatic disbursement indicator of 2 or 3, the number of lead days prior to the next expected escrow disbursement date the disbursement should be processed.  Defaults from company information.

LNEscInstlt2DisbDte.description: Expected disbursement date for the second escrow installment.  Format:  MMDD where M is month and D is date.

LNEscCoSubcategory.description: Identifies the company subcategory associated with the escrow, as defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

LNEscNbrOfInstallments.description: For loans with a disbursement frequency of 9 (other), the number of annual installments, from 1 to 4.

LNEscCoCat.description: Identifies the escrow company category, as defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

LNEscInstlt4DisbDte.description: Expected disbursement date for the fourth escrow installment.  Format:  MMDD where M is month and D is date.

LNEscInsExpDte.description: Date the insurance escrow (Escrow Type I) or RBP escrow (Escrow Type R) expires.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNEscInstlt3DisbDte.description: Expected disbursement date for the third escrow installment.  Format:  MMDD where M is month and D is date.

LNEscAutoDisbInd.description: Indicates which types of disbursements are allowed.  Valid values are 0, 1, 2, 3, and 9.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for detailed information.

LNEscDelInd.description:
Indicates whether this escrow segment will be added or deleted.  
 Blank  Add.  
 D  Delete.

LNEscInstlt2DisbAmt.description: Disbursement amount for the second escrow installment.

LNEscInstlt3DisbAmt.description: Disbursement amount for the third escrow installment.

LNEscInstlt1DisbAmt.description: Disbursement amount for the first escrow installment.

LNEscInstlt4DisbAmt.description: Disbursement amount for the fourth escrow installment.

LNEscDisbFreq.description:
Indicates how often an escrow is disbursed.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 9  Other.

LNEscCkGrpNbr.description: Identifies the check group number assigned to automatic disbursements with a check recipient code of G (no check) or S (set check).

TiedTo.description: Note or commitment number to which the fee is tied.

BillFreq.description:
Frequency of billing for account- and commitment-level fees.
 1 Daily.
 2 Monthly.
 3 Quarterly.
 4 Semiannual.
 5 Annual.

Typ.description:
Fee Type.
 A Account fee.
 N Note fee.
 C Commitment fee.

EarnInd.description: Method of earnings for this fee.

CurAssessAmt.description: Amount which has been assessed to this account since the last bill.

CatCde.description:
Fee Category.
 LT Late fee.
 EX Extension fee.
 MS Miscellaneous fee.
 CS Cost.
 PP Prepayment penalty fee.

TotAmtDue.description: Total amount which has been billed on this fee for this account.

CurAmtDue.description: Amount which has been billed to this account for the current period.

UnearnAmt.description: Remaining amount of fee to be taken into earnings over time.

EarnAmt.description: Total amount of fee taken into earnings.

AmtWaivYTD.description: Amount which has been waived on this fee for this account.

DelInd.description:
Indicates if the fee is deleted.
 Y Yes.  The fee is deleted.
 N or blank No.  The fee is not deleted.

TranAmt.description: Amount of accrued interest to be transferred.

TranCde.description:
Transaction code.  
 780  To change loan status to nonaccrual.  
 782  To change loan status to accrual.  
 783  To change loan status to deferred active.  
 784  To transfer memo accrued interest to active accrued interest.

MinAmt.description: For loans with sold participations, minimum amount of accrued interest that can be transferred.  This amount is the total of accrued interest on the participations.

NoteNbr.description: Loan System note number.  For Comerica implementation, the calling application (IVR) will always pass in '1' since draw activity exists under the revolving credit note.

CnfrmNme.description: After the function has completed sucessfully, the loan name will be returned.

CnfrmMsg2.description: After the function has completed sucessfully, the loan confirmation message will be returned.

CnfrmMsg1.description: After the function has completed sucessfully, the loan confirmation message will be returned.

MaxAmt.description: Maximum amount of accrued interest that can be transferred.

EffDte.description: Effective date of the transaction.

NonAccrCde.description:
For nonaccrual transactions, identifies the reason for the nonaccrual status. 
 B  Bankruptcy.  
 J  Judgment.  
 N  Nonaccrual (no reason assigned).  
 R  Repossession.

FeeHistWavTxnAmt.description: Dollar amount of a fee waiver transaction.

FeeHistReversedTxnCde.description: For a fee reversal, the transaction code of the transaction that was reversed.

FeeHistFeeBal.description: Balance on the fee after the transaction posts.

FeeHistSrcCde.description: Input source of the transaction. For example, 530 is CRT. For an explanation of the code, see Chapter 1 of the Loans Balancing  Procedures Manual.

FeeHistFeeAmtWavYtd.description: Year-to-date total amount of fee assessments waived for this fee.

LNFeeHistTranSeqNbr.description: System-defined number identifying multiple transactions with the same effective date.

FeeHistEntdDte.description: Date transaction was entered in the system.

FeeHistFeeAmtAssdCur.description: Amount which has been assessed to this account since the last bill.

FeeHistRevrslInd.description: An asterisk in this field indicates transaction has been reversed.

FeeHistFeePlnDesc.description: Description of the fee as set up on Bank Control.

FeeHistFeeBalAfterRevrsl.description: Balance on the fee after the reversal transaction posts.

FeeHistFeeBalAfterWav.description: Balance on the fee after the waiver transaction posts.

VltryInsBilledNotPdAmt.description: Amount of voluntary insurance billed but not paid.

DayToStp.description: For category R loans, number of days loan is past due before insurance reserve stops accruing.

YTDAccr.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued year to date.

RteChgInd.description:
For category R loans, indicates the effect of a rate change made at the subcategory level. May default from Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).  Valid values are Y or N.  Default value is N.
 N Affects new reserve segments only.
 Y Affects new and existing reserve segments.

TrmntAge.description: For insurance reserves, age at which the customer�s coverage ceases and the reserve is automatically inactivated.  May default from the company record, as defined on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).  If entered, the Loan System will automatically calculate and fill LN Reserve Termination Date field accordingly.  Currently not available on inquiry.

ResrvRte.description: For reserves with an earnings/rebate method of 1, 3, or B, the rate at which the reserve accrues if different from the rate specified on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM). For insurance reserves, rate is per $1000.00 of coverage per day.

ChrgbkDte.description: System-calculated date after which the bank can no longer recover the full amount of the dealer reserve, based on the value specified in the CHARGEBACK DAYS field on Dealer Plan Segment 480 of Bank Control.

MTDPdAmt.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest paid month to date.

InsCapAmt.description: For accruing insurance, the maximum loan amount the company will insure. May default from the company record, as defined on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).

TrmntResnCde.description:
Indicates reason for termination of the reserve.
 0 Age termination feature not used, or reserve not terminated.
 1 Terminated at customer�s request.
 2 Terminated at request of financial institution.
 3 Terminated at request of company.
 4 Terminated due to death of insured.
 5 System termination - insured reached maximum age for coverage.
 6 Manual termination - insured reached maximum age for coverage.
 7 Coverage extended due to extension of loan.
 8-20 User-defined.

YTDPdAmt.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest paid year to date.

MTDAccr.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued month to date.

EarningRebateMeth.description: Indicates earnings/rebate calculation method for a reserve.  Valid values:  1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N, O, P, Q, S.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for meanings of the values.

EffDte.description: Date reserve begins earning or rebating.

LTDPdAmt.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest paid since the loan originated.

VltryInsPmtTyp.description:
For voluntary insurance, indicates how the premium is calculated if the customer�s loan payment changes. May default from Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM). 
 0 Not recalculated.
 1 Calculated as a percentage of principal and interest.
 2 Calculated as a percentage of principal and interest plus escrow.
 3 Calculated as a percentage of principal and interest plus escrow and other voluntary insurance.

CurAccr.description: The current amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued.

RsrvNbr.description: Identifies the insurance or dealer reserve.

LTDAccr.description: The amount of insurance or dealer interest accrued since the loan originated.

PrpseCde.description:
Identifies the type of company, as defined on Company Basic Maintenance (LNCBM).
 D Dealer.
 I Insurance.

ClaimFiledInd.description: Indicates whether a claim has been filed against the reserve.  Y or N.  Default value is N.

Amt.description: Total amount of the dealer or insurance reserve. For insurance with an earnings/rebate method of 6, the monthly or biweekly premium amount.

RecourseNbr.description: For dealer reserves, the percentage of the loan for which the bank is reimbursed if the customer defaults on the loan. Informational only.

PrepaidInd.description: Indicates whether the reserve is prepaid.  Y or N.  Default value is N.

VltryInsMaxPremAmt.description: For voluntary insurance, the maximum amount of the monthly premium. May default from the company record, as defined on Company Category Maintenance (LNCCM).

VltryInsPndAmt.description: Amount of the currently pending voluntary insurance premium. On the pending premium date, the pending premium overrides the current amount if the amounts are different.

TrmntDte.description: Date on which the reserve is terminated. Defaults to loan maturity date.   If LN Reserve Termination Age field is entered, Loan System will automatically calculate and fill this field accordingly.

CoNbr.description: Identifies a set of company options and defaults, as defined on Company Basic Maintenance (LNCBM).

Subcategory.description: Identifies a company subcategory, as defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

Cat.description: Identifies a company category, as defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

VltryInsPndDte.description: For voluntary insurance, the effective date of the pending premium.

BenAmt.description: For reserve earnings/rebate method S only, the payment amount on which the daily accrual calculation is based.  For all other reserve earnings/rebate methods, the field defaults to 0.00 and will not allow entry.

NewRteOver.description: The rate over, after this transaction.

RateUnderMargin.description: For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.

Index.description: Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

PricePlan.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

NxtRteChgDte.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RtePln.description: Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered.

Basis.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year.

RteChgFreq.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.

RateUnderRelInd.description: Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %).

SeqNbr.description: Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date.

EffDte.description: Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

KwdHi.description: High value of the Bill Type F selection criteria keyword range.

OldExcesYld.description: The excess yield, before this transaction.

LNCategory.description:
Identifies the loan category for account-level rate changes (Rate Indicator is A).  Rate change will be applied only to notes of this category.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 R  Revolving credit.  
 S  Specific accounts receivable.

RateCap.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change.

OldRteUnder.description: The rate under, before this transaction.

KwdLow.description: Low value of the Bill Type F selection criteria keyword range.

RateOverMargin.description: For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

RateOverRelInd.description: Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

NewRteUnder.description: The rate under, after this transaction.

SplitLimitAmt.description: Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under.

RelDte.description: Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RateUnder.description: For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.

OldRteOver.description: The rate over, before this transaction.

NewExcessYld.description: The excess yield, after this transaction.

RateOver.description: For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

SelKwd.description:
Selection criteria keyword by which to select Bill Type F floor plan loans for rate change.  
 LNNFPOPT  Floor plan option.  
 LNNFPST  Floor plan status.

LNTotPrevSchedDte.description: Effective date of payment schedule from which the bill was dropped.

LNTotLstScheduledPmtNbr.description: Payment number of last bill associated with total last schedule date.

LNIntNxtBillDte.description: If an interest-only or maturity payment schedule (Payment Type Zero), date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNTotLstBillDte.description: Due date of last bill associated with total last schedule date.

LNTotPrevBillDte.description: Due date of bill associated with total previous schedule date.

LNIntNxtSchedDte.description: Effective date of payment schedule from which the bill is to be dropped.

LNIntPrevScheduledPmtNbr.description: Payment number for previous interest bill associated with interest previous schedule date.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNTxnCde.description: Identifies the type of transaction.

LNTotPrevScheduledPmtNbr.description: Payment number of previous bill associated with total previous schedule date.

LNIntPrevBillDte.description: Due date of previous interest bill associated with interest previous schedule date.

LNIntLstScheduledPmtNbr.description: Payment number for last interest bill associated with interest last schedule date.

LNTotNxtBillDte.description: If not an interest-only or maturity payment schedule, date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNIntPrevSchedDte.description: Effective date of payment schedule from which the bill was dropped.

LNTotPrinBilledNotPd.description: Total principal amount billed.  Excludes curtailments.  A zero balance removes loan from past due reports.

LNIntLstBillDte.description: Due date of last interest bill associated with interest last schedule date.

LNCurPrinDue.description: Last principal amount billed.  Field does not reset to zero, even when full amount paid.

LNIntNxtScheduledPmtNbr.description: Payment number for next interest bill associated with interest next schedule date.

LNIntLstSchedDte.description: Effective date of payment schedule from which the bill was dropped.

LNTotNxtSchedDte.description: Effective date of payment schedule from which the bill is to be dropped.

LNTotIntBilledNotPd.description: Total interest amount billed.  A zero balance removes loan from past due reports.

LNTotNxtScheduledPmtNbr.description: Payment number of next bill associated with total next schedule date.

LNTotLstSchedDte.description: Effective date of payment schedule from which the bill is dropped.

LNCurIntDue.description: Current interest amount billed.  Field does not reset to zero, even when full amount paid.

LNFloorPlanAcctIntRev.description: Amount of interest reversed for floor plan account.

LnFloorPlanAcctPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed for floor plan account.

LnCORecIntRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered interest reversed.

LnNSFFeeOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override automatic fee assessment associated with Transaction Code 801.  Y or N.

LNTxnSeqNbr.description: Sequence number of transaction being reversed.

LnAcctOldTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account before the transaction.

LnRevPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed.

LnCORecPrinRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered principal reversed.

LnCORecFeeRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered fees reversed.

LnCurrLineOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override the OVER LIMIT COMMITMENT ALLOWED field on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Contol when that field is N (no), thus allowing the commitment line of credit to be exceeded.  Y or N.

LNRevLevlInd.description:
Code indicating level of transaction being reversed. 
A  Floor Plan Account 
F  Fee

LNTxnCde.description:
Indicates the type of monetary transaction.  Common reversal transactions include the following: 
 800, 803 - 806  Dollar amount posting reversal; for any reason except nonsufficient funds and fee transactions.  
 801 Payment reversal with NSF fee.  
 810  Fee reversal.

LnDefActAccrRev.description: Amount of deferred active accrual reversed.

LNTxnEffDte.description: Effective date of transaction being reversed.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNPndRelDte.description: Date the pending payment transaction will be processed.  If date is a nonprocessing day, transaction will post on next processing day.  For added transactions, defaults to today�s date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNSkipAutoInd.description: Indicates whether to prevent the automatic reversal of any system-generated transactions (including participation transactions) associated with the transaction being reversed.  Y or N.

LnBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple reversal transactions into one total.

LnAcctNewTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account after the transaction.

LNBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple transactions into one total.

LNBillFreq.description:
For commitment- and account-level fees, frequency with which the fee will be billed.  May default from Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.  
 <B>1  Daily 
 2  Monthly  
 3  Quarterly  
 4  Semiannually 
 5  Annually

LNCombBillIndBnkCntl.description: A value of '@' returned here indicates that the Combined Bill Indicator will default from Fee Plan Segment 430 on Bank Control.

LNCombBillInd.description:
Indicates whether late charges appear on statements.  May default from Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.  
 Y  Yes, include late charges due on the Loan Statement (R-6090).  
 N  No, do not include late charges due on the Loan Statement (R-6090). 
 C  Include miscellaneous fees (fee category MS) on the Loan Statement (R-6090).  
 Q  Include  predicted late charge on the Revolving Credit Statement (R-6088).   
 R  Include fee associated with a revolving credit note on the Revolving Credit Statement (R-6194).

LNFeeAssessmentNbr.description: Number assigned by the Loan System to identify the fee assessment.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNCredtBurCalculationInd.description:
Determines whether the fee should be included in the credit bureau current balance calculation. 
 Y  Include fee in current balance.  
 N  Exclude fee from current balance.

LNRltNote.description: Identifies the note to which this fee is tied.

LNFeeDueDte.description: For commitment- or account-level fees, date on which the first bill is due.

LNEarnTerm.description: Number of months over which the fee is earned.

LNRebateableInd.description: For accounts with straight-line earnings, indicates whether unearned portion of fee will be rebated to  customer.  May default from Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.

LNStrtEarnDte.description: For accounts with an earnings indicator other than 9, the date on which fee begins earning; for accounts with an earnings indicator of 9, fees begin earning at the end of the current month, regardless of the start earnings date.

LNCapitalizationIndBnkCntl.description: A value of '@' returned here indicates that the Capitalization Indicator will default from Fee Plan Segment 430 on Bank Control.

LNCapitalizationInd.description:
Indicates whether the fee will be capitalized.  May default from Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.  

 N  Do not capitalize fee 
 P  Capitalize fee, do not bill customer 
 Y  Capitalize fee, include in bill

LNFeePln.description: Identifies the fee plan tied to the loan, as defined on Bank Control Fee Plan Segment 430.

LNChrgDPInd.description:
For fees that are to be charged to a deposit account, indicates type of account.  
 D  Demand Deposit
 S  Savings

LNDPAcctNbr.description: For fees charged to a deposit account, the account number.

LNExclLtFeeMatIndBnkCntl.description: A value of '@' returned here indicates that the Exclude Late Fee Maturity Indicator will default from Fee Plan Segment 430 on Bank Control.

LNDsplyToCustInd.description: Indicates whether fees are displayed on customer inquiries and statements.   May default from Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.  Extension fees, late fees, miscellaneous fees, and prepayment fees will default to Y.  Costs will default to N.

LNDesc.description: Description of fee plan, as defined on Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.

LNExclLtFeeMatInd.description:
For accounts with a fee category of LT, indicates whether late fee assessment is excluded on past due maturity bills and postmaturity bills.  May default from Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.  
 B  Exclude on both postmaturity and maturity bills.  
 N  Exclude on neither postmaturity nor maturity bills.  
 P  Exclude on postmaturity bills only.  
 Y  Exclude on maturity bills only.

LNAcctNme.description: The name associated with the account.

LNPmtAmt.description: If full or partial payment is being made, dollar amount.

LNRltCmmt.description: Identifies the commitment to which this fee is tied

LNDsplyToCustIndBnkCntl.description: A value of '@' returned here indicates that the Display to Customer Indicator will default from Fee Plan Segment 430 on Bank Control.

LNEarnInd.description:
Indicates how fees are earned.  May default from Fee Plan Segment 430 of Bank Control.  
 4  Straight-line earnings (note and commitment fees).  
 7  Straight-line until exercised (commitment fees only).  
 8  Defer earnings until exercised (commitment fees only).  
 9  Interest method earnings (note fees only).

LNFloorPlanAcctIntRev.description: Amount of interest reversed for floor plan account.

LnFloorPlanAcctPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed for floor plan account.

LnCORecIntRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered interest reversed.

LnNSFFeeOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override automatic fee assessment associated with Transaction Code 801.  Y or N.

LNTxnSeqNbr.description: Sequence number of transaction being reversed.

LnAcctOldTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account before the transaction.

LnRevPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed.

LnCORecPrinRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered principal reversed.

LnCORecFeeRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered fees reversed.

LnCurrLineOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override the OVER LIMIT COMMITMENT ALLOWED field on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Contol when that field is N (no), thus allowing the commitment line of credit to be exceeded.  Y or N.

LNRevLevlInd.description:
Code indicating level of transaction being reversed. 
F  Fee 
P  Participation

LNTxnCde.description:
Indicates the type of monetary transaction.  Common reversal transactions include the following: 
 800, 803 - 806  Dollar amount posting reversal; for any reason except nonsufficient funds and fee transactions.  
 801 Payment reversal with NSF fee.  
 810  Fee reversal.

LnDefActAccrRev.description: Amount of deferred active accrual reversed.

LNTxnEffDte.description: Effective date of transaction being reversed.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNSkipAutoInd.description: Indicates whether to prevent the automatic reversal of any system-generated transactions (including participation transactions) associated with the transaction being reversed.  Y or N.

LnBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple reversal transactions into one total.

LnAcctNewTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account after the transaction.

IntRte.description: Interest rate established on Bank Control Escrow Interest Plan.

IntFreq.description:
Indicates when interest is posted.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 5  When escrows are disbursed.  
 6  Annually and when escrows are disbursed.

CalMethod.description:
Method used to calculate interest.  
 S  Simple.  
 D  Daily.  
 C  Continuous.

IntPdEOPY.description: Total interest paid end of prior year.

IntWthhldEOPY.description: Total interest withheld end of prior year.

LstIntPdDte.description: Date on which interest was last posted.

ExemptStatEOPY2.description: Exempt status end of Prior Year 2.  Same values as Exempt Status Indicator.

ExemptStatEOPY3.description: Exempt status end of Prior Year 3.  Same values as Exempt Status Indicator.

NextPayDte.description: Overrides pay date based on the Interest Frequency and First Pay Date fields on Bank Control Escrow Interest Plan 465.

BNoticeDte.description: Date B-notice is sent to the customer.

ExemptStatEOPY1.description: Exempt status end of Prior Year 1.  Same values as Exempt Status Indicator.

BasisDay.description:
Number of days in month and year used for interest calculation.  
 0  Actual day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual day month/365-day year.

ExemptStatInd.description:
The backup withholding status of the interest-bearing escrow account.  
 0  Exempt (assumed).  
 1  Exempt (foreign account).  
 2  Exempt (corporation).  
 3  Exempt (recipient).  
 4  Exempt (confirmed).  
 5  Exempt (awaiting TIN).  
 6  Exempt (B-notice sent).  
 7  Exempt (W-9 returned certified).  
 8  Exempt (second B-notice sent).  
 9  Exempt (released from withholding through IRS). 
 A  Not exempt (IRS incorrect TIN).  
 B  Not exempt (IRS underpay).  
 C  Not exempt (no form on file).  
 D  Not exempt (bank missing ID).  
 E  Not exempt (B-notice sent).  
 F  Not exempt (account delinquent in returning W-9).  
 I  Not exempt (second B-notice sent).  
 J  Not exempt (second B-notice sent, not released from withholding through IRS).

OvrrdeInd.description: Indicates whether to override the calculated next pay date determined on Bank Control Escrow Interest Plan.

MoreInd.description: A 'Y' in this field indicates there is more data to be returned.

NbrRec.description: The number of records returned in the inquiry.

RepoRecNbr.description: Will return a value if there is more data to be returned.  To view the next set of data, resubmit the inquiry using the value returned here.

LNFloorPlanAcctIntRev.description: Amount of interest reversed for floor plan account.

LnFloorPlanAcctPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed for floor plan account.

LnCORecIntRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered interest reversed.

LnNSFFeeOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override automatic fee assessment associated with Transaction Code 801.  Y or N.

LNTxnSeqNbr.description: Sequence number of transaction being reversed.

LnAcctOldTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account before the transaction.

LnRevPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed.

LnCORecPrinRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered principal reversed.

LnCORecFeeRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered fees reversed.

LnCurrLineOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override the OVER LIMIT COMMITMENT ALLOWED field on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Contol when that field is N (no), thus allowing the commitment line of credit to be exceeded.  Y or N.

LNRevLevlInd.description:
Code indicating level of transaction being reversed. 
A  Floor Plan Account 
F  Fee

LNTxnCde.description:
Indicates the type of monetary transaction.  Common reversal transactions include the following: 
 800, 803 - 806  Dollar amount posting reversal; for any reason except nonsufficient funds and fee transactions.  
 801 Payment reversal with NSF fee.  
 810  Fee reversal.

LnDefActAccrRev.description: Amount of deferred active accrual reversed.

LNTxnEffDte.description: Effective date of transaction being reversed.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNSkipAutoInd.description: Indicates whether to prevent the automatic reversal of any system-generated transactions (including participation transactions) associated with the transaction being reversed.  Y or N.

LnBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple reversal transactions into one total.

LnAcctNewTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account after the transaction.

NewRteOver.description: The rate over, after this transaction.

RateUnderMargin.description: For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.

Index.description: Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

PricePlan.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

NxtRteChgDte.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RtePln.description: Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered.

Basis.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year.

RteChgFreq.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.

RateUnderRelInd.description: Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %).

SeqNbr.description: Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date.

EffDte.description: Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

PartNbr.description: If rate change is to a participation sold, enter the participating bank number.

OldExcesYld.description: The excess yield, before this transaction.

RateCap.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change.

OldRteUnder.description: The rate under, before this transaction.

NoteNbr.description: Note number.  If account-level rate change, enter zeros.

RateOverMargin.description: For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

RateOverRelInd.description: Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

NewRteUnder.description: The rate under, after this transaction.

SplitLimitAmt.description: Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under.

RelDte.description: Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RateUnder.description: For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.

OldRteOver.description: The rate over, before this transaction.

NewExcessYld.description: The excess yield, after this transaction.

RateOver.description: For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

PartSeq.description: Participation sequence number.  If rate change is to a participation sold, the sequence number of the participation.

LNTotPmtAmt.description: Amount of total payment, not including buydowns, for this schedule.  The amount is optional for interest-only schedules but is required for the remaining schedule types.  For Loan Category P, the initiating institution's P&I.

LNPrinAndIntAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans only, the fixed principal and interest portion of the payment.

LNPmtPlnNbr.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans, identifies the payment plan used to calculate the payment, as defined on Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.

LNPmtEffDte.description: Date the new payment schedule begins.  If payment frequency is 5, this is the maturity date.  99 in DD portion for last day of month.  1-30 in DD portion to bill on DD entered.  For paid-date loans, this date cannot be 29 or 30.  For A/R, floor plan, and any loans that are to receive pooled billings, a date must be entered containing 99 in DD.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNNbrOfPayments.description: The number of bills produced in a past schedule, or the number of bills to be produced in a current or future schedule.

LNPmtFreq.description:
Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular; creates a bill effective date on the payment schedule but does not affect the next bill date.

LNPmtTyp.description: Determines the payment method for the loan.  Possible values are 0 (zero), A, B, C, D, E, F, G, J, P, and S.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for details of the different payment types.

LNPmtPct.description: Outstanding balance percentage billed.  For revolving credit (Category R) loans, the percentage to be used in calculating the amount billed.  For Payment Type P, defaults from Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.

LNEscrAmt.description: Escrow amount included in the total payment.  Amount includes regular escrows only.

LNBusDay.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans, number representing the nth business day of the month on which the Revolving Credit Statement is produced.  Valid values are 1 through 18.  If this field is blank, statements are produced on the monthly anniversary date of the payment schedule effective date.

LNBuydwnAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans only, portion of the payment supplied by someone other than a borrower.

LNMinPmtAmt.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans, the minimum payment amount to be billed.  For Payment Type P, defaults from Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.

LNChrgInd.description:
For automatic bill payments, indicates the type of account to which a bill is charged.  
 A  Automated Funds Transfer System.  
 D  DDA.  
 P  Trust Account P (currently not used).  
 I  Trust Account I (currently not used).  
 S  Savings.

DigitalSignature.description: A HEX string digital signature.  Identifies a specific customized set of fields to be returned by the CIS Dynamic Customer Profile.

LiabLmtPerc.description: Percentage of the account or note being guaranteed or endorsed.

LiabBalAmt.description: Current amount of the indirect liability.

LiabLmtMsg.description: UNLIMITED appears if liability is unlimited.

LiabNoteNbr.description: Identifies the note being guaranteed or endorsed.  ALL appears if the entire account is guaranteed or endorsed.

BenAcctNoteBalAmt.description: Current balance of the note benefiting from the indirect liability. If the entire account is guaranteed or endorsed (ALL appears in place of the note number), this is the entire account balance.

LiabLmtAmt.description: Dollar amount of the account or note being guaranteed or endorsed.

LiabNoteMissInd.description: An asterisk (*) in this field indicates that the note does not exist.

LiabNoteMissMsg.description: This field will contain DOES NOT EXIST when the note doesn't exist.

LiabAcctNbr.description: Identifies the account being guaranteed or endorsed.

NoteNbr.description: Additional note number associated with this account.

SearchBillDueDte.description: This field can be used to inquire starting with a specific bill due date.

BillStatusInqInd.description:
This field can be used to inquire on a selected bill status.  If not filled, will default to all bills. 
 A  Paid ahead. 
 P  Paid.  
 U  Unpaid.

NbrRows.description: The actual number of bills returned, up to 50.  If Number of Rows is zero, no bills meet the criteria.

MoreTxnInd.description: A 'Y' in this field indicates there are more bills to be returned.

LNEscrRte.description: Escrow interest rate.  Defaults to the rate on the Company Category Maintenance screen (LNCCM) if LN Escrow Type is I.

LNActvInactvInd.description: Any value other than zero indicates the escrow is inactive.  Code can be user-defined to indicate the reason for an inactive escrow.  0 = Active.

LNPndFhaAnvrsyMth.description: Month/year when the final (12th) portion of next year's premium will be remitted.  System-calculated in the 11th month for RBP escrows, and is 12 months later than the current anniversary date.  Represented as MMCCYY.  Default is zeroes.

LNNxtDisbDte.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1 or 2.

LNUsrCde.description: User-defined code to further identify an escrow segment.

LNCustRcpntCde.description:
Indicates whether the borrower or the company payee receives escrow disbursements.  Default is 0 (zero) if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 2 (noncollected).  
 C  Customer (borrower).  
 P  Payee (taxing authority or insurance company, for example).   
 0  Not applicable.

LNTrtsAddsTxnInd.description:
TRTS (TICOR) ADDS transaction indicator.  
 1  Delete.  
 2  Add.  
 3  Change.  
 Automatically set to 2 at new note time if the following applies:  The Automated Escrow Billing Indicator on page 2 of Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is Y; the  Customer Number on page 2 of Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is greater than zero; the Company Purpose Code is E (escrow); and the Tape Processing Agency Number is 17 (First American Real Estate Tax Service--FARETS).  Reset to spaces after ADDS tape for this period is produced.  Can be manually entered; must be manually entered for Values 1 and 3.

LNR7360Ind.description:
Indicates whether a request for a bill or a receipt is printed on the Tax Bill Request Notice (R-7360).  
 B  Bill.  
 R  Receipt.  
 N  Not applicable; no notice is produced.  
 When you set up a new note, the existing company field, R-7360 Default, provides  the following default functions:   If the R-7360 Default field is 0 (N/A) or P (Payee), the LN R-7360 Request Print Indicator note field defaults to N.  If the R-7360 Default field is C (Customer), the LN R-7360  Request Print Indicator note field defaults as follows:  For regular escrows (LN Escrow Collection Method 1), default is B.  For noncollected escrows (LN Escrow Collection Method 2), default is R.  For reserve escrows (LN Escrow Collection Method 3), default is N.

LNCkRcpnt.description:
For automatic disbursements.  Note:  If this field is not properly filled, escrow checks will not be produced.  
 C  Customer.  
 P  Payee (company).  
 B  Both customer and payee.  
 N  No check; paid list.  
 G  No check; paid list  is printed in group number order.  
 L  List disbursement; one check per company payee.  
 S  Set disbursement; one check per group per company payee.

LNDisbMeth.description:
Determines the disbursement amount for automatic and mass disbursements.  Can default from the payee's company record.  
 A  Current escrow balance.  
 B  Projected disbursement until end-of-year.  
 C  Amount to disbursement date (include delinquents).  
 D   Next expected disbursement amount.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

LNInsCoverAmt.description: Amount of coverage allowed by insurance policy.  For RBP escrows, is required and is equal to the original  mortgage amount less financed points and up-front premiums.  Can also apply to FHA or PMI insurance escrows.

LNNxtDisbAmt.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1.

LNCurFhaAnvrsyMth.description: Current payment anniversary date.  Month/year when the final (12th) payment of the current year's FHA or RBP premium will be remitted.  This date is later than the issue date, but sooner than the maturity date.  Represented as MMCCYY.  Default is zeroes.

LNDisbExcpInd.description:
Indicates whether automatic disbursement is allowed.  
 Y  Yes.  
 N  No.  
 X  Do not allow any disbursements.

LNNbrOfInstallments.description: Number of installments, from one through four, to make per year for the escrow.  Applies only if the LN Disbursement Frequency is 9 and/or the LN Even Amount Escrow Disbursement Indicator is N.

LNTrtsHitCde.description: TRTS (TICOR) hit code.  Automatically updated with TRTS update tape.  Can be manually entered.

LNPyeNbr.description: Payee to whom the escrow will be disbursed as defined on the company database.

LNInsExpDte.description: For insurance escrows, the policy's expiration date.

LNLstDisbDte.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1 or 2.

LNColMeth.description:
Escrow collection method.  
 1  Fixed dollar amount collected as part of the payment (regular escrows).  
 2  Noncollected (memo).  
 3  Held; collected up front; special assessment (used for reserve escrows).

LNCoSubcategory.description: Subcategory number defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control.

LNAutoDisbStat.description:
Indicates whether an escrow disbursement can be made; used with LN Automatic Disbursement Indicator of 3 or 9.  
 A  Not ready to disburse.  
 B  Ready to disburse.

LNDisbFreq.description:
Indicates how often the escrow is disbursed.  If the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 3, this field must be 9.  
 0  Unknown or not available.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 9  Other.

LNPremCalcMeth.description:
Premium calculation method used for RBP escrows.  
 SC  Straight calculation.  
 AS  Amortization schedule factor tables.  
 PF  Premium factor tables.

LNEscrIntInd.description: Indicates whether escrow interest is paid upon escrow disbursement.  Y or N.  Applicable only if the Interest Disbursement Frequency value on Escrow Interest Plan Segment 465 of Bank Control is 5 or 6.

LNEvenInstltInd.description: If there is more than one escrow disbursement per year, this field indicates whether all disbursements are the same or at least one is different.  Y or N.

LNEscrTyp.description:
Escrow type.  
 F  FHA.  
 I  Insurance.  
 O  Other.  
 P  PMI.  
 R  RBP (FHA risk-based premium).  
 T  Tax.

LNTrtsCntrtSfx.description: TRTS (TICOR) contract suffix.  Automatically updated with TRTS update tape.  Can be manually entered.

LNYTDDistAmt.description: For FHA escrows, this is the anniversary year-to-date amount.  For all other escrows, this is the calendar year-to-date amount.

LNTaxInsIdentificationMaintCde.description:
Escrow ID maintenance code.  
 Blank  Inquire.  
 A  Add.  
 C  Change.  
 D  Delete.

LNCkGrpNbr.description: User-defined number for automatic disbursements with a LN Escrow Check Recipient value of G (no check; paid list by group) or S (set check).

LNPndPrem.description: Annual premium amount for the next FHA anniversary year for FHA escrows.  System-calculated in the 11th month for RBP escrows.

LNAutoDisbInd.description:
Determines the disbursement method.  Can default from the payee's company record.  
 0  No automatic disbursements, but mass and individual disbursements are allowed.  
 1  Automatic, one-time disbursement on the specified next expected disbursement date.   
 2  Fully automatic disbursements occur according to the next expected disbursement date and the number of lead days.  
 3  Automatic disbursements like Option 2, but disbursements will only occur when you set the disbursement status to B (ready to disburse).  
 9  Mass disbursement allowed when the disbursement status is B (ready to disburse).

LNAutoDisbLeadDay.description: Number of days before the next disbursement date that an automatic disbursement is generated.

LNTaxInsIdentificationNbr.description: Line number for the tax ID or policy number.  Values are 01 through 99 or system-assigned beginning with 01.

PriorYTDDisb.description: Prior year-to-date disbursed amounts for all escrow types.

LNCoCat.description: Three-character user-defined category code defined on Company Description Segment 445 of Bank Control, such as TAX or INS.

LNLstDisbAmt.description: Required if the LN Escrow Collection Method field is 1.

LNFloorPlanAcctIntRev.description: Amount of interest reversed for floor plan account.

LnFloorPlanAcctPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed for floor plan account.

LnCORecIntRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered interest reversed.

LnNSFFeeOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override automatic fee assessment associated with Transaction Code 801.  Y or N.

LNTxnSeqNbr.description: Sequence number of transaction being reversed.

LnAcctOldTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account before the transaction.

LnRevPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed.

LnCORecPrinRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered principal reversed.

LnCORecFeeRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered fees reversed.

LnCurrLineOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override the OVER LIMIT COMMITMENT ALLOWED field on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Contol when that field is N (no), thus allowing the commitment line of credit to be exceeded.  Y or N.

LNRevLevlInd.description:
Code indicating level of transaction being reversed. 
C  Charge-off/Non-Accrual Dual Accounting 
F  Fee 
I  Floor Plan Note

LNTxnCde.description:
Indicates the type of monetary transaction.  Common reversal transactions include the following: 
 800, 803 - 806  Dollar amount posting reversal; for any reason except nonsufficient funds and fee transactions.  
 801 Payment reversal with NSF fee.  
 810  Fee reversal.

LnDefActAccrRev.description: Amount of deferred active accrual reversed.

LNTxnEffDte.description: Effective date of transaction being reversed.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNPndRelDte.description: Date the pending payment transaction will be processed.  If date is a nonprocessing day, transaction will post on next processing day.  For added transactions, defaults to today�s date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNSkipAutoInd.description: Indicates whether to prevent the automatic reversal of any system-generated transactions (including participation transactions) associated with the transaction being reversed.  Y or N.

LnBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple reversal transactions into one total.

LnAcctNewTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account after the transaction.

PercRte1.description: Percentage rate at which fee is being assessed.

DisplayToCustInd.description:
Indicates whether fees are displayed on customer inquiries and statements.
 Y Yes, fees are displayed on customer inquiries and statements (default for EX, LT, MS, and PP fees).
 N No, fees are not displayed on customer inquiries and statements (default for CS fees).

CalcMeth1.description:
Calculation method.
 P Percentage rate.
 D Dollar rate.

CurAssessAmt.description: Amount which has been assessed to this note since the last bill.

AssessStrtDte.description: Date on which to start assessing this fee.

Desc.description: Description of the fee as set up on Bank Control.

NoteCalcInd.description: Indicates whether fee is calculated using the note rate.

BasisCde.description:
Code identifying the accrual basis.
 0 Actual days/360 day year.
 3 30 day month/360 day year.
 5 365 day year/actual day year.
 7 Actual day year/actual day year.
 9 30 day month/365 day year.

StrtEarnDte.description: When fee will start taking earnings.

EarnTerm.description: Number of months fee will take earnings.

TotBillAmt.description: Amount billed and unpaid to date.

UnearnAmt.description: Represents the unearned amount for this month. The earned amount and unearned amount will not always equal the original amount. Earnings may have already been calculated for the month (reducing unearned) but will not be displayed in the EARNED field until month end.

MinFeeAmt.description: Minimum amount which can be assessed for this fee.

EarnAmt.description: Total amount of fee taken into earnings life-to-date. For fees tied to a plan with a lifetime maximum fee assessment cap, assessments will no longer be allowed once this amount reaches that maximum.

DelInd.description:
Indicates if the fee is deleted.
 Y Yes.  The fee is deleted.
 N or blank No.  The fee is not deleted.

ExclLtFeesMat.description:
Identifies whether delinquent maturity bills and delinquent postmaturity bills should be assessed a late fee.
 B Exclude late fees on maturity and postmaturity bills.
 N Do not exclude late fees on maturity or postmaturity bills.
 P Exclude postmaturity bills, but assess late fees on maturity bills.
 Y Exclude maturity bills, but assess late fees on postmaturity bills.

MaxFeeAmt.description: Maximum amount which can be assessed for this fee.

CombBillInd.description:
Identifies whether late charges due are to be printed on the Loan Statement (R-6090).
 C Include miscellaneous (MS) fees on the Loan Statement (R-6090).
 N No, do not include fees on the Loan Statement (R-6090).
 P For a predicted late charge, the message - AFTER MM/DD/YY A LATE CHARGE OF ZZ,ZZ9.99 WILL BE ASSESSED - appears on the Loan Statement (R-6090). Currently not used without special programming.
 Q For a predicted late charge, the message - AFTER MM/DD/YY A LATE CHARGE OF ZZ,ZZ9.99 WILL BE ASSESSED - appears on the Revolving Credit Statement (R-6088).
 R Fee is billed with a revolving credit and appears on the Revolving Credit Statement (R-6088) if the assessment type is A.
 Y Yes, include late charges due on the Loan statement (R-6090). Valid for Fee Category LT only.

UnpaidCapFee.description: Amount of capitalized fees not paid.

PrevPmtDueDte.description: Date the previous payment was due.

EarnMethInd.description:
Fee method used to calculate earnings.
 0 Earn immediately.
 4 Straight line.
 7 Straight line until exercised.
 8 Defer earnings until exercised.
 9 Interest method.

NextBillDte.description: Date when the next bill will be dropped.

NextAssessDte1.description: Date the next assessment will occur.

RltKeyFld1.description: Note or commitment to which the fee is related.

FrstDueDte.description: First date a payment is due. May be zeros.

RebateInd.description: Y or N if fee is rebateable.

DolrRte1.description: Dollar rate at which fee is being assessed.

BillFreq.description:
Frequency of billing for account- and commitment-level fees.
 1 Daily.
 2 Monthly.
 3 Quarterly.
 4 Semiannual.
 5 Annual.

Typ.description:
Fee type.
 A Account fee.
 N Note fee.
 C Commitment fee.

AssessAmtYTD.description: Amount assessed on fee for this note year-to-date.

CapFeeInd.description:
Capitalize fee indicator.
 Y Yes, capitalize the fee when statement is created.

 9  Verify current PIN.

To update from B to N, use Authority Code of 0 and enter a New PIN along with the new value in this field.  To update from N to B, use Authority Code of 0 and enter the new value in this field.

TranCde.description:
Identifies the type of monetary transaction and its effects.  
 550  Financed reserves will be rebated.  For simple interest loans, original charge-off transaction; accruing reserves are terminated and financed insurance is maintained.  For add-on loans, loan balance less unearned interest is charged off; financed insurance or dealer reserves continue.  
 551  For add-on loans only, partial charge-off transaction; reserves are terminated.  
 552  For add-on loans only, partial charge-off transaction; reserves are not terminated.  
 555  For add-on loans only, complete charge-off transaction; loan balance minus current unearned interest and current reserve balances is charged off; reserves are terminated.  
 556  For simple interest loans with financed insurance only, complete charge-off transaction; financed reserves are terminated.  
 560  For simple interest and add-on loans, increases charge-off balance of partially charged-off loans

RelDte.description: Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RateUnder.description: For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.

OldRteOver.description: The rate over, before this transaction.

NewExcessYld.description: The excess yield, after this transaction.

RateOver.description: For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

MoreInd.description: A value of 'Y' indicates there are more enrollments to be returned in this query.  To view the rest of the enrollments, use the reposition field described.

AcctNbr.description: The unique ID of the customer or account to search for related enrollments.

SubAcctNbr.description: For deposit accounts, the related time deposit ID.  For loan accounts, the related note number.  When this element is 0 or not provided, the summary results will be a composite view across the entire account.

RepoEnrlmtID.description: Will contain a value if there are more enrollments to be returned.  To view the next set of enrollments, resubmit the inquiry using the value returned here.

NbrRequested.description: Number of enrollments to be returned.  Up to 25 enrollments can be requested.  This element is ignored when the search is performed for an account since an account search will return a maximum of one enrollment.

IntAccrYTD.description: Total cost-of-funds accrual for the year.

LstStlmtDte.description: Last date that the cost of funds accrual amount was reset to zero.

Flr.description: Lowest rate that can be used to calculate the cost-of-funds accrual.

RteChgFreq.description:
Controls when the cost-of-funds interest rate changes in relation to when the cost-of-funds index changes.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.
 
 D Rate changes on a specific day of month in which the index changes. If the specific day is a nonworking day, the change occurs on the next working day.
 L Rate changes on the last work day of the month in which the index changes.
 N Rate changes on the next work day following the index change.
 2 Rate changes on the first working day of the month following the index change.
 3 Rate changes on the first work day of the quarter following the index change.
 0 Rate changes the day of an index change.
 R Rate changes the day following an index change.
 M Rate changes the Monday after an index change.
 T Rate changes the Tuesday after an index change.
 W Rate changes the Wednesday after an index change.
 H Rate changes the Thursday after an index change.
 F Rate changes the Friday after an index change.
 1 Rate changes the first day of the month following an index change.
 E Rate changes monthly following an index change.

IntAccrLTD.description: Total cost-of-funds accrual for the life of the loan.

IntAccrMTD.description: Total cost-of-funds accrual for the month.

StlmtFreq.description:
Along with the settlement term, represents the amount of time between the last settlement date and the next settlement date.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.
 
 0 Changed manually.  
 1 Daily.  
 2 Monthly.  
 3 Yearly.

AccrAmt.description: Cost-of-funds accrual from the last settlement date until today.

Celng.description: Highest rate that can be used to calculate the cost-of-funds accrual.

StlmtTerm.description: Along with settlement frequency, represents the amount of time between the last settlement date and the next settlement date.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.

NxtStlmtDte.description: Next date that the cost of funds accrual amount is reset to zero.  Based on the last settlement date, settlement frequency, and settlement term, if available.

ExistSegInd.description:
This value is returned when an inquiry is performed.
 
 Y  The segment exists, which means any changes made will be applied to the current segment.  For existing segments, the Rate, Index, Margin, Relationship, and Basis cannot be maintained via this function.  They must be maintained using LNCOFRteChg.  Any new values entered in the previously mentioned fields will be ignored.
 N  The segment doesn't exist, which means that the segment is being added.

LNRvlvgInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is revolving.  Y or N.

LNCollCde.description: User-defined code intended to identify the collateral securing a commitment.

LNAutoDrawDelinquencyInd.description: For revolving credit notes, determines whether the draw indicator is automatically set to N when a bill remains unpaid for the number of days specified in LN Auto Draw Delinquency Days field.  May default from Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNImmdPrnCmmtNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the number of the parent commitment.  For a stand-alone commitment, the number of the commitment itself.

ComtPrtPrtyNbr.description: For participated commitments, identifies the order in which payments or draws are applied to the participation when an ascending or descending sequential payment or draw method is used.

LNPrcPlnNbr.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.

ComtUsedBal.description: Total outstanding draws made against the commitment.

LNApprovalDte.description: Effective date of the commitment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNOrigAmt.description: Amount for which the commitment is initially established.

ComtUltParAcctNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the account of the commitment at the top of the hierarchy. For a stand-alone commitment, the account of the commitment itself.

LNCmmtTypBnkCntl.description: Represents a set of commitment options and defaults, as defined on Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNFedCallCde.description: Identifies the loan classification for federal call report purposes, as defined on Classification Segment 415 of Bank Control.

LNOrigTermInd.description:
Represents the length of time between the approval date and the expiration date. 
D  No expiration date indicated.  
  R  Term is 13 months or more.  
 T  Term is 12 months or less.

LNDesc.description: User-entered description which overrides the commitment description set on Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNCmmtRvwDte.description: Date the commitment is due for review.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNOvheadTypCde.description: User-defined code to indicate the method of calculating overhead costs during profitability analysis.  May default from Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNTerm.description: Term of the commitment expressed in months.

LNPartCde.description:
Indicates the participation status of the commitment.  
 B  Bought; commitment purchased from another financial institution.  
 N  Not a commitment participation.

TLCInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is part of a TLC (total line of credit) relationship.  Y or N.

LNDrawInd.description: Determines whether a draw can be made against a commitment.  For revolving credit notes with an automatic draw delinquency indicator of Y, may reset to N when a bill remains unpaid for the number of days specified in LN Auto Draw Delinquency Days field.

LNAutoDrawDelinquencyDay.description: For revolving credit notes, the number of days after the bill due date that the draw indicator is set to N if the bill remains unpaid, preventing additional draws against the commitment.  May default from Commitment Type Segment 425 of Bank Control.

LNUsgInd.description: User-defined code intended to provide further identification of a commitment.

LNAdvisementLvl.description:
Indicates whether the customer is aware of the commitment and, if so, whether the commitment is an informal or legal agreement. 
 A  Advised.  Customer is aware of the agreement by way of informal verbal or written notice.  
 B - F  User-defined.  
 G  Guidance.  Commitment is established for internal purposes; customer is not aware of its existence.  
 H - K  User-defined.  
 L  Legal.  A binding legal document exists between the financial institution and the customer.  
 M - T  User-defined.  
 U  Under review.  Customer is aware of the agreement by way of informal verbal or written notice.  
 V - Z  User-defined.

LNSecuredInd.description:
Indicates whether the commitment is secured by collateral on the Collateral System.  
 B  Secured, but collateral not on Collateral System.  
 N  Not secured.  
 Y  Secured with collateral on Collateral System.

ComtUnusedBal.description: Difference between the current commitment amount and commitment used amount.

LNPndInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is pending, causing any usage to create an exception condition.

ComtPrtFundingMeth.description:
For participated commitments, identifies the method used to distribute a draw made against the commitment.  
 A  Ascending sequential order.  
 D  Descending sequential order.  
 P  Pro rata.

ComtUltParComtNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the number of the commitment at the top of the hierarchy. For a stand-alone commitment, the number of the commitment itself.

ComtAvailBal.description: Amount of the commitment balance currently available to the borrower.

ComtPrtPmtMeth.description:
For participated commitments, identifies the method for distributing a payment.  
 A  Ascending sequential order.  
 D  Descending sequential order.  
 P  Pro rata.

LNBrnchNbr.description: Identifies the branch, as defined on Branch Segment 105 of Bank Control.

LNParticipatingBnkNbr.description: For commitments with a participation status indicator of B, identifies the bank involved in the participation, as indicated in the company record established on Company Basic Maintenance (LNCBM).

LNCollPct.description: Percentage of collateral required on the unused portion of the commitment.

ComtCurBal.description: Current approved amount of the commitment.

LNRdcAvail.description: Indicates whether the commitment amount immediately reduces the available balance on the parent commitment.  Reduced availability is not allowed for TLC or ultimate parent commitments.  Y or N.

LNCBCLInd.description: Indicates whether this commitment is for a collateral-based credit line.  Y or N.

LNAdjAvailAmt.description: For collateral-based credit line, the maximum available amount based on the current value of the collateral.

LNPCMAInd.description: Indicates whether the account is part of a Personal Cash Management relationship.  Y or N.

LNLstRiskRtg.description: System-generated date indicating the last change to the risk rating code.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD where C is century, Y is year, M is month, and D is date.

LNUsrCde1.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

CRACode.description: User-defined code intended for Community Reinvestment Act (CRA) reporting at the commitment level.

LNUsrCde4.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNUsrCde5.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNUsrCde2.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNUsrCde3.description: User-defined code intended to provide additional report sorting options.

LNTakedownDte.description: For a stand-alone commitment, date the commitment should be reduced to zero if not used.

LNActvStatCde.description: With the exception of the system-assigned value of P for paid, represents a user-defined code intended to indicate the status of a commitment.

LNRiskRtg.description: User-defined code intended to identify the collection risk associated with the commitment.

ComtLeadPrtInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment is the primary commitment in a participated commitment structure.

ComtPercentageOwned.description: For a participated commitment, the calculated percentage of the commitment constituted by the participation.

LNImmdPrnAcctNbr.description: For a subcommitment, the account of the parent commitment.  For a stand-alone commitment, the account of the commitment itself.

LNExpDteInd.description:
Indicates whether the available balance that is interfaced to the general ledger is reduced to zero when the commitment expires.
 Y (Yes) - Reduce the commitment available balance that is interfaced to general ledger to zero (0.00) when the commitment expires.
 B (Both) - Reduce the commitment available and the commitment unused balances that are interfaced to general ledger to zero (0.00) when the commitment expires.
 N (Neither) - Do not reduce commitment available and commitment unused balances that are interfaced to general ledger to zero (0.00) when the commitment expires.

CoApplRaceOATxt.description: Used with Code 27 in any Co-applicant / Co-borrower Race field, the name of the co-applicant's or co-borrower's other Asian race(s), if provided by the first Co-applicant or Co-borrower.
