NewRteOver.description: The rate over, after this transaction.

RateUnderMargin.description: For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.

Index.description: Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

PricePlan.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

NxtRteChgDte.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RtePln.description: Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered.

Basis.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year.

RteChgFreq.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.

RateUnderRelInd.description: Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %).

SeqNbr.description: Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date.

EffDte.description: Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

OldExcesYld.description: The excess yield, before this transaction.

LNCategory.description:
Identifies the loan category for account-level rate changes (Rate Indicator is A).  Rate change will be applied only to notes of this category.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 R  Revolving credit.  
 S  Specific accounts receivable.

RateCap.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change.

OldRteUnder.description: The rate under, before this transaction.

RateOverMargin.description: For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

RateOverRelInd.description: Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

NewRteUnder.description: The rate under, after this transaction.

SplitLimitAmt.description: Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under.

RelDte.description: Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RateUnder.description: For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.

OldRteOver.description: The rate over, before this transaction.

NewExcessYld.description: The excess yield, after this transaction.

RateOver.description: For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

TierId.description: The unique ID for the tier within the package this enrollment is assigned to.

QualifyAcctInd.description: Indicates if the account has the role of qualification.  Y or N.  Only returned when the search is performed for an account.

PkgFlexId.description: The user-entered ID for the package this enrollment is assigned to.  This ID is used to identify the package when setting up flex pricing plans.

AnchorAcctInd.description: Indicates if the account has the role of anchor.  Y or N.  Only returned when the search is performed for an account.

TierNme.description: The name of the tier within the package this enrollment is assigned to.

EnrlmtId.description: The unique ID for this enrollment.

TierFlexId.description: The user-entered ID for the tier within the package this enrollment is assigned to.  This ID is used to identify the tier when setting up flex pricing plans.

PkgNme.description: The name of the package this enrollment is assigned to.

PkgId.description: The unique ID for the package this enrollment is assigned to.

ForcedTierInd.description: Indicates if the user forced the enrollment into the current tier.  Y or N.

BnfAcctInd.description: Indicates if the account has the role of benefit.  Y or N.  Only returned when the search is performed for an account.

LNFloorPlanAcctIntRev.description: Amount of interest reversed for floor plan account.

LnFloorPlanAcctPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed for floor plan account.

LnCORecIntRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered interest reversed.

LnNSFFeeOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override automatic fee assessment associated with Transaction Code 801.  Y or N.

LNTxnSeqNbr.description: Sequence number of transaction being reversed.

LnAcctOldTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account before the transaction.

LnRevPrin.description: Amount of loan principal balance reversed.

LnCORecPrinRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered principal reversed.

LnCORecFeeRev.description: Amount of charge-off recovered fees reversed.

LnCurrLineOvrrd.description: Determines whether to override the OVER LIMIT COMMITMENT ALLOWED field on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Contol when that field is N (no), thus allowing the commitment line of credit to be exceeded.  Y or N.

LNRevLevlInd.description:
Code indicating level of transaction being reversed. 
C  Charge-off/Non-Accrual Dual Accounting 
F  Fee 
I  Floor Plan Note

LNTxnCde.description:
Indicates the type of monetary transaction.  Common reversal transactions include the following: 
 800, 803 - 806  Dollar amount posting reversal; for any reason except nonsufficient funds and fee transactions.  
 801 Payment reversal with NSF fee.  
 810  Fee reversal.

LnDefActAccrRev.description: Amount of deferred active accrual reversed.

LNTxnEffDte.description: Effective date of transaction being reversed.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNPndRelDte.description: Date the pending payment transaction will be processed.  If date is a nonprocessing day, transaction will post on next processing day.  For added transactions, defaults to today�s date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

LNSkipAutoInd.description: Indicates whether to prevent the automatic reversal of any system-generated transactions (including participation transactions) associated with the transaction being reversed.  Y or N.

LnBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple reversal transactions into one total.

LnAcctNewTotalOwed.description: Organization�s share of the total owed on the account after the transaction.

LstUpdtUsrId.description: ID of the last user who updated any of the multiple collateral records. Consists of the first character and last 3 characters of the user ID.

NbrCollDeleted.description: Number of collaterals deleted by this function.

TotAmt.description: System-calculated total dollar amount of all multiple collateral.

LstUpdtDte.description: Date a user last updated any of the multiple collateral records.

TotPercentage.description: System-calculated percentage of the total dollar amount of all multiple collateral to the loan�s current balance.

NbrCollChanged.description: Number of collaterals changed by this function.

NbrCollAdded.description: Number of collaterals added by this function.

Desc.description: User-defined description field.  To clear contents, enter the word 'blank' to space out the existing data.

Amt1.description: User-defined amount field 1.  Enter a value in the range of +/- 9,999,999,999,999.99.  Include the minus sign if entering a negative number.  To clear contents, enter 0.00.

Desc1.description: User-defined description field 1.  To clear contents, enter space(s).

Date1.description: User-defined date field 1.  Format CCYY-MM-DD.  To clear contents, enter 0000-00-00.

LNBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple account payments into one total.

LNWarnMsg.description: Gives additional information about error conditions.

LNPartSpreadInd.description: Indicates whether to override the automatic participation spread field on the loan when that field is Y, indicating the system automatically distributes principal and interest portions of a payment to any associated participations. A Y in this field prevents automatic distributions.

LNEffDte.description: Transaction effective date.  Can be backdated.

LNBillSeq.description: Number assigned to the account bill by the system if there are multiple account bills with the same bill due date.

LNReleaseDte.description: Date on which the transaction will be processed. System enters the current date.

NewRteOver.description: The rate over, after this transaction.

RateUnderMargin.description: For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.

Index.description: Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

PricePlan.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

NxtRteChgDte.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RtePln.description: Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered.

Identifies the accrual basis.

 3  30-day month/360-day year.

 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year.

Stat.description:
Identifies the accrual status of the loan.
 
 A Accrual.
 B Nonaccrual; bankruptcy.
 C Complete charge-off.
 CA Partial charge-off;accrual.
 CB Partial charge-off; bankruptcy.
 CD Charge-off/deferred (active).
 CJ Partial charge-off; judgment.
 CN Partial charge-off; nonaccrual.
 CR Partial charge-off; repossession.
 DA Deferred (active).
 J Nonaccrual; judgment.
 N Nonaccrual; no special status.
 R Nonaccrual; repossession.

IntDueAmt.description: Total interest accrued on the loan.  If interest is financed, a zero appears in the PAYOFF field.

Cat.description:
Indicates loan type.
 
 C Commercial.
 E Student loan.
 F Floor plan.
 G General accounts receivable.
 I Installment.
 M Mortgage.
 P Purchased loan.
 R Revolving credit.
 S Specific accounts receivable.

BillTyp.description:
Controls the way bill segments are created and affects how payments are applied.
 
 0 Bill-cycled (without bill segments); floor plan (floor plan indicator on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is 0).
 A Due date-to-due date or amortizing.
 B Bill-cycled (with bill segments).
 C Payment date-to-payment date.
 F Bill-cycled (with bill segments); floor plan (floor plan indicator on Processing Option Segment 400 of Bank Control is 2).

TotPayoff.description: Total amount due to pay off the loan.  Whether buydown, escrow, or escrow reserve amounts are included is  determined by the payoff indicator(s) on Bank Control Note Option Segment 410.

StrtDte.description: Payment due date of the first coupon to be ordered, or the default value, which is the next unbilled payment.

LstStrtDte.description: Payment due date of the first coupon ordered in the previous coupon order.

LstAnalysisDte.description: Date that the escrow payment will change as a result of the next escrow analysis.

CpnDropResn.description:
Coupon Drop Code.
 0 Not applicable
 1 Produce coupon book now
 2 Produce coupon book one month in advance
 3 Do not produce coupon books
 Coupon Reason Code.
 0 No coupons used for this note
 1 New note needs coupons
 2 Next coupon book for existing note
 3 Reorder a book

LstNumOrdr.description: Number of coupons ordered in the previous coupon order.

NxtBillDte.description: Date of the next undropped bill. This date is the default date for the COUPON START DATE field.

LstOrdDte.description: Date the note last appeared on the Coupon Order report (R-7200).

NxtPmtChgDte.description: Date the payment will change on the variable plan note.

NbrCpn.description:
Number of coupons to be ordered, or the default value, which is the computed number of payments from the payment due date of first coupon through (and inclusive of) the payment due date of last coupon.
 Tip: If the number of coupons you order is greater than the number of coupons specified on Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, you will receive the following message: WARNING: NUMBER OF COUPONS EXCEEDS FREQUENCY ON NOTE TYPE. The order will still be processed.

ThroughDte.description:
Payment due date of the last coupon to be ordered, or the default value, which is the earliest of the following dates:
 - Last installment on the note�s payment schedule
 - Next variable plan payment change date minus one payment
 - Automatic coupon order date minus one payment
 - Maturity date
 - Next payment effective date

NxtPmtDueDte.description: Date of the oldest unpaid bill.

NxtStrtDte.description: Date of the first coupon of the next book to be ordered.

NxtAnalysisDte.description: Date that the escrow payment will change as a result of the next escrow analysis.

NteLstPmtSchedDte.description: Final installment date of the note�s final payment schedule.

NteNoBillInd.description: Indicates how the borrower will be billed. This field must be C (coupons) or L (coupons for regular payments, bills for late charge fees) to order coupons through the Coupon Order function.

IntRte.description: Interest rate established on Bank Control Escrow Interest Plan.

IntFreq.description:
Indicates when interest is posted.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 5  When escrows are disbursed.  
 6  Annually and when escrows are disbursed.

CalMethod.description:
Method used to calculate interest.  
 S  Simple.  
 D  Daily.  
 C  Continuous.

IntPdEOPY.description: Total interest paid end of prior year.

IntWthhldEOPY.description: Total interest withheld end of prior year.

LstIntPdDte.description: Date on which interest was last posted.

ExemptStatEOPY2.description: Exempt status end of Prior Year 2.  Same values as Exempt Status Indicator.

ExemptStatEOPY3.description: Exempt status end of Prior Year 3.  Same values as Exempt Status Indicator.

NextPayDte.description: Overrides pay date based on the Interest Frequency and First Pay Date fields on Bank Control Escrow Interest Plan 465.

BNoticeDte.description: Date B-notice is sent to the customer.

ExemptStatEOPY1.description: Exempt status end of Prior Year 1.  Same values as Exempt Status Indicator.

BasisDay.description:
Number of days in month and year used for interest calculation.  
 0  Actual day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual day month/365-day year.

ExemptStatInd.description:
The backup withholding status of the interest-bearing escrow account.  
 0  Exempt (assumed).  
 1  Exempt (foreign account).  
 2  Exempt (corporation).  
 3  Exempt (recipient).  
 4  Exempt (confirmed).  
 5  Exempt (awaiting TIN).  
 6  Exempt (B-notice sent).  
 7  Exempt (W-9 returned certified).  
 8  Exempt (second B-notice sent).  
 9  Exempt (released from withholding through IRS). 
 A  Not exempt (IRS incorrect TIN).  
 B  Not exempt (IRS underpay).  
 C  Not exempt (no form on file).  
 D  Not exempt (bank missing ID).  
 E  Not exempt (B-notice sent).  
 F  Not exempt (account delinquent in returning W-9).  
 I  Not exempt (second B-notice sent).  
 J  Not exempt (second B-notice sent, not released from withholding through IRS).

OvrrdeInd.description: Indicates whether to override the calculated next pay date determined on Bank Control Escrow Interest Plan.

LNFeeWavBatchNbr.description: User-defined number used to group multiple transactions into one total.

LNFeeWavCnfrmNewFeeBal.description: Balance after waiver has been applied.

LNAcctNme.description: Short name of the account to which the transaction was applied.

LNFeeWavAmt.description: Amount of fee to be waived.

NoteNbr.description: Loan System note number.  For Comerica implementation, the calling application (IVR) will always pass in '1' since draw activity exists under the revolving credit note.

LNPartNme.description: When a participation payment is made as part of renewal, the name of the participation that received payment.  Eighteen occurrences with element IDs 33042, 33046, 33050 . . . 33110.

LNPartPrinPd.description: When a participation payment is made as part of renewal, the amount of principal paid.  Eighteen occurrences with element IDs 33044, 33048, 33052 . . . 33112.

LNPartNewBal.description: When a participation payment is made as part of renewal, the new participation balance after payment.  Eighteen occurrences with element IDs  33043, 33047, 33051 . . . 33111.

NewRteOver.description: The rate over, after this transaction.

RateUnderMargin.description: For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.

Index.description: Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

PricePlan.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

NxtRteChgDte.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RtePln.description: Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered.

Basis.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year.

RteChgFreq.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.

RateUnderRelInd.description: Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %).

SeqNbr.description: Unique user-assigned number that differentiates this transaction from other transactions sent to pending that have the same release date.  The first transaction sent to pending can be allowed to default to blank.  However, you must assign a sequence number to any subsequent transactions with the same release date.

EffDte.description: Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

PartNbr.description: If rate change is to a participation sold, enter the participating bank number.

OldExcesYld.description: The excess yield, before this transaction.

RateCap.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change.

OldRteUnder.description: The rate under, before this transaction.

NoteNbr.description: Note number.  If account-level rate change, enter zeros.

RateOverMargin.description: For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

RateOverRelInd.description: Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

NewRteUnder.description: The rate under, after this transaction.

SplitLimitAmt.description: Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under.

RelDte.description: Identifies the date on which the transaction should be released from the pending file.  If the release date is not entered, or if the release date entered is in the past, the system forces the effective date of the transaction to be equal to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RateUnder.description: For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.

OldRteOver.description: The rate over, before this transaction.

NewExcessYld.description: The excess yield, after this transaction.

RateOver.description: For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

PartSeq.description: Participation sequence number.  If rate change is to a participation sold, the sequence number of the participation.

StrtDte.description: Payment due date of the first coupon to be ordered, or the default value, which is the next unbilled payment.

LstStrtDte.description: Payment due date of the first coupon ordered in the previous coupon order.

LstAnalysisDte.description: Date that the escrow payment will change as a result of the next escrow analysis.

CpnDropResn.description:
Coupon Drop Code.
 0 Not applicable
 1 Produce coupon book now
 2 Produce coupon book one month in advance
 3 Do not produce coupon books
 Coupon Reason Code.
 0 No coupons used for this note
 1 New note needs coupons
 2 Next coupon book for existing note
 3 Reorder a book

LstNumOrdr.description: Number of coupons ordered in the previous coupon order.

NxtBillDte.description: Date of the next undropped bill. This date is the default date for the COUPON START DATE field.

LstOrdDte.description: Date the note last appeared on the Coupon Order report (R-7200).

NxtPmtChgDte.description: Date the payment will change on the variable plan note.

NbrCpn.description:
Number of coupons to be ordered, or the default value, which is the computed number of payments from the payment due date of first coupon through (and inclusive of) the payment due date of last coupon.
 Tip: If the number of coupons you order is greater than the number of coupons specified on Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, you will receive the following message: WARNING: NUMBER OF COUPONS EXCEEDS FREQUENCY ON NOTE TYPE. The order will still be processed.

ThroughDte.description:
Payment due date of the last coupon to be ordered, or the default value, which is the earliest of the following dates:
 - Last installment on the note�s payment schedule
 - Next variable plan payment change date minus one payment
 - Automatic coupon order date minus one payment
 - Maturity date
 - Next payment effective date

NxtPmtDueDte.description: Date of the oldest unpaid bill.

NxtStrtDte.description: Date of the first coupon of the next book to be ordered.

NxtAnalysisDte.description: Date that the escrow payment will change as a result of the next escrow analysis.

NteLstPmtSchedDte.description: Final installment date of the note�s final payment schedule.

NteNoBillInd.description: Indicates how the borrower will be billed. This field must be C (coupons) or L (coupons for regular payments, bills for late charge fees) to order coupons through the Coupon Order function.

Rte.description: Cost-of-funds interest rate.  Applies to fixed-rate loans only.

IndxOvr.description: If the relationship is points based, enter the number of points the cost-of-funds rate floats over or under the index rate.

IntAccrYTD.description: Total cost-of-funds accrual for the year.

LstStlmtDte.description: Last date that the cost of funds accrual amount was reset to zero.

Flr.description: Lowest rate that can be used to calculate the cost-of-funds accrual.

RteChgFreq.description:
Controls when the cost-of-funds interest rate changes in relation to when the cost-of-funds index changes.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.
 
 D Rate changes on a specific day of month in which the index changes. If the specific day is a nonworking day, the change occurs on the next working day.
 L Rate changes on the last work day of the month in which the index changes.
 N Rate changes on the next work day following the index change.
 2 Rate changes on the first working day of the month following the index change.
 3 Rate changes on the first work day of the quarter following the index change.
 0 Rate changes the day of an index change.
 R Rate changes the day following an index change.
 M Rate changes the Monday after an index change.
 T Rate changes the Tuesday after an index change.
 W Rate changes the Wednesday after an index change.
 H Rate changes the Thursday after an index change.
 F Rate changes the Friday after an index change.
 1 Rate changes the first day of the month following an index change.
 E Rate changes monthly following an index change.

IntAccrLTD.description: Total cost-of-funds accrual for the life of the loan.

IndxOvrPct.description: If the relationship is percentage-based, enter the percentage of the index at which the cost-of-funds rate floats.

IntAccrMTD.description: Total cost-of-funds accrual for the month.

StlmtFreq.description:
Along with the settlement term, represents the amount of time between the last settlement date and the next settlement date.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.
 
 0 Changed manually.  
 1 Daily.  
 2 Monthly.  
 3 Yearly.

Indx.description: Index number.  Identifies the index, as defined on Index Segment 125 of Bank Control, that is used to calculate the cost of funds rate.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.

Rlt.description: Defines the relationship between the margin and the index (+, -, or %).

AccrAmt.description: Cost-of-funds accrual from the last settlement date until today.

Celng.description: Highest rate that can be used to calculate the cost-of-funds accrual.

StlmtTerm.description: Along with settlement frequency, represents the amount of time between the last settlement date and the next settlement date.  May default from Bank Control Note Option Segment 410, page 5.

NxtStlmtDte.description: Next date that the cost of funds accrual amount is reset to zero.  Based on the last settlement date, settlement frequency, and settlement term, if available.

ExistSegInd.description:
This value is returned when an inquiry is performed.
 
 Y  The segment exists, which means any changes made will be applied to the current segment.  For existing segments, the Rate, Index, Margin, Relationship, and Basis cannot be maintained via this function.  They must be maintained using LNCOFRteChg.  Any new values entered in the previously mentioned fields will be ignored.
 N  The segment doesn't exist, which means that the segment is being added.

NewFeeBal.description: Balance after payment has been applied.

Batch.description: User-defined number used to group multiple transactions into one total.

LNFeePymtTransCd.description:
Identifies the type of monetary transaction.
 680 Fee payment. 
 687 Fee payment.

AcctNme.description: Short name of the account to which the transaction was applied.

BnkNbr.description: Identifies participant company record defined on the Company Basic Maintenance screen.

CmmtPrtInd.description: Sold indicator. If sold will have a value of 'S.'

Prty.description: If using an ascending or descending payment method and/or funding method, identifies the order in which draws and/or payments are applied.

CmmtPrtNbr.description: Identifies the portion of a lead commitment sold to a participant.

PrcPln.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.

Typ.description: Identifies commitment participation�s commitment type as defined on Commitment Type Segment 425. Defaults to the commitment type of the lead commitment.

RCInd.description: Indicates whether the commitment participation balance is reduced by  participation payments.  Defaults to the revolving credit indicator of the  lead commitment.  Y or N.

NewRteOver.description: The rate over, after this transaction.

RateUnderMargin.description: For variable split-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.

Index.description: Identifies the index to which this loan is related, as defined on Index Rate Segment 125 of Bank Control.

PricePlan.description: Identifies the pricing plan associated with the account.  May default from the pricing plan on the related commitment.

NxtRteChgDte.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Identifies the date when note is eligible for the next rate change.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

RtePln.description: Rate plan number.  Identifies a specific rate plan record to which the note is tied, as defined on Rate Plan Segment 455 of Bank Control.  To remove a rate plan from a note, a zero must be entered.

Basis.description:
Identifies the accrual basis.  
 0  Actual-day month/360-day year.  
 3  30-day month/360-day year.  
 5  Actual-day month/365-day year.  
 7  Actual-day month/actual-day year.  
 9  30-day month/365-day year.

RteChgFreq.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Determines when the note interest rate will change based on changes made to the related index.  For all other loan types, use the appropriate keyword to change this field.

RateUnderRelInd.description: Relationship of margin under to index rate.  For variable split-rate loans, the relationship of the margin under to the index (+, - or %).

EffDte.description: Date the rate change is to be effective.  Defaults to today's date.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD

PartNbr.description: If rate change is to a participation sold, enter the participating bank number.

OldExcesYld.description: The excess yield, before this transaction.

RateCap.description: For Category R (revolving credit) Bill Type B loans that are tied to an index and do not have a split rate or rate plan attached to them.  Sets the amount the interest rate can move up or down per rate change.

OldRteUnder.description: The rate under, before this transaction.

NoteNbr.description: Note number.  If account-level rate change, enter zeros.

RateOverMargin.description: For floating-rate loans, the numeric relation to the index rate.  Expressed as points or a percentage.  If less than 1%, a zero must be entered to the left of the decimal point.  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

RateOverRelInd.description: Relationship of margin over to index rate.  For floating-rate loans, the relationship of the margin over to the index (+, - , or %).  Also used for variable split-rate loans.

NewRteUnder.description: The rate under, after this transaction.

SplitLimitAmt.description: Split-rate limit.  For split-rate loans, this is the division point.  Any balance over this limit accrues at the rate over; any balance under and up to this limit accrues at the rate under.

RateUnder.description: For fixed split-rate loans, the rate to be charged on the portion of principal under and including the split-rate limit.

OldRteOver.description: The rate over, before this transaction.

NewExcessYld.description: The excess yield, after this transaction.

RateOver.description: For fixed-rate loans, the interest rate of the note.  For fixed split-rate loans, the rate for the balance over the split-rate limit.  For notes tied to a variable plan, the initial rate of the note represented as nnn.nnnnnn.  All nine digits need not be entered if a decimal is entered.

PartSeq.description: Participation sequence number.  If rate change is to a participation sold, the sequence number of the participation.

EscrIntAccrIncluded.description: Escrow interest accrual included in the payoff.

Rsrv1TotAmt.description: Reserve amount due. For voluntary insurance, this is the reserve amount billed not paid amount.

EscrBalExcluded.description: Amount of escrow balances excluded in payoff calculation.

InPrinCd.description:
Indicates which balance (current or scheduled) and which accrual basis (loan accrual basis or payoff accrual basis) are used in calculating the loan payoff.  
 1Accrue on current balance from the last full, regular payment to the payoff date.
 2Accrue on current balance from the last regularly scheduled payment due date to the payoff date.
 3Accrue on amortized balance from the last regularly scheduled payment due date to the payoff date.

OutEffDte.description: Effective date of the payoff inquiry

EscrRsrvExcluded.description: Amount of escrow balances excluded in payoff calculation.

EscrBalIncluded.description: Amount of escrow balances included in payoff calculation.

IntAccRebHldStat.description: For accruing rebates and interest, indicates whether to stop accruals. For financed rebates, indicates whether to hold rebate figures.  This will be 'HOLD' if the rebate should be held.

IntGoodThruDte.description: Date through which interest amount is good.

Total2Amt.description: Total amount due to pay off loan between the first good-through date and the second good-through date. There will be a different payoff amount and date in this field only if there is financed interest or financed reserves.

IntAmt.description:
Unpaid accrued interest.

 Note: If you specified a different payoff calculation method in Input Accrual Basis, Input Principal Code, and/or Input Months for a BIll Type A loan, this amount is based on that calculation method.

QuoteEffDte.description: Effective date if payoff quote was saved on the Payoff Request screen (LNPOQ).

Rsrv1EarningMeth.description:
Earnings Method. Earned rebate method from EARN/REB field on loan or reserve.
 ACC Accrual
 CHB Chargeback
 HLD Prepaid
 REB Rebate
 STD Voluntary insurance

FhaHoldbackAmtExcluded.description: Amount of FHA insurance excluded in the payoff.

CurBal.description: Unpaid principal balance on processing date.

UnapldBal.description: Amount of the unapplied funds balance.

TotAccRebHldStat.description: For accruing rebates and interest, indicates whether to stop accruals. For financed rebates, indicates whether to hold rebate figures.  This will be 'HOLD' if the rebate should be held.

IntPdToDte.description: Date to which interest is paid.

FhaHoldbackAmtIncluded.description: Amount of FHA insurance included in the payoff.

InMonths.description: If you want to withhold FHA insurance premiums from this quote, enter the number of months to withhold premiums.

EscrIntIncluded.description: Escrow interest included in the payoff.

UnpdExtnFeesAmt.description: Amount of extension fees due. Rebates have been subtracted from unpaid extension fees.

BuydwnAmtExcluded.description: Amount of buydown balance excluded in payoff calculation.

OutBasis.description: Accrual basis used for payoff inquiry.  See Input Accrual Basis for code values.

OutMonths.description: The number of months FHA insurance premiums were withheld for payoff inquiry.

Rsrv1GoodThruDte.description: Date through which rebate amount is good.

BuydwnAmtIncluded.description: Amount of buydown balance included in payoff calculation.

InBasis.description:
Identifies the payoff accrual basis.  Defaults to the loan accrual basis.  
 0 Actual-day month/360-day year
 3 30-day month/360-day year
 5 Actual-day month/365-day year
 7 Actual-day month/Actual-day year
 9 30-day month/365-day year

AllOthReservesTotAmt.description: If an account has more than 5 reserves, this is the total amount of the other reserves.

TellerActyAmt.description: For revolving credit loans, amount posted to Deposit System via On-line Dollar or Teller, but not yet posted to Loan System. This activity is already added to the CURRENT BALANCE field; however, it is not part of the loan history.

TotGoodThruDte.description: Date through which rebate amount is good.

EscrIntExcluded.description: Escrow interest excluded from the payoff.

IntEarningMeth.description:
Indicates the interest earnings rebate method.  
 ACC Accrual
 CHB Chargeback
 HLD Prepaid
 REB Rebate
 STD Voluntary insurance

OutPrinCd.description: Principal code used for payoff inquiry.  See Input Principal Code for code values.

OthFeesAmt.description: Amount of other fees due. Rebates have been subtracted from unpaid other fees.

Total2GoodThruDte.description: Second date through which rebate amount is good.

EscrRsrvIncluded.description: Amount of escrow reserve balances included in payoff calculation.

EscrIntWithheldIncluded.description: Escrow interest withheld included in the payoff.

TotAmt.description: Total amount due to pay off loan. When rebate figures are included, the payoff is good as long as the rebate amount is good (as identified in the Good Through Date field).

PdAheadBuydwnExcluded.description: Paid ahead buydown balance excluded in payoff calculation.

Rsrv1AccRebHldStat.description: For accruing rebates and interest, indicates whether to stop accruals. For financed rebates, indicates whether to hold rebate figures.  This will be 'HOLD' if the rebate should be held.

EscrIntWithheldExcluded.description: Escrow interest withheld excluded from the payoff.

EscrIntAccrExcluded.description: Escrow interest accrual excluded from the payoff.

InEffDte.description: Effective date of the payoff inquiry.

TotBuydwnExcluded.description: Total amount of buydown balance excluded in payoff calculation.

KwdHi.description: High value of the Bill Type F selection criteria keyword range.

OldExcesYld.description: The excess yield, before this transaction.

LNCategory.description:
Identifies the loan category for account-level rate changes (Rate Indicator is A).  Rate change will be applied only to notes of this category.  
 C  Commercial.  
 F  Floor plan.  
 I  Installment.  
 M  Mortgage.  
 R  Revolving credit.  
 S  Specific accounts receivable.

SelKwd.description:
Selection criteria keyword by which to select Bill Type F floor plan loans for rate change.  
 LNNFPOPT  Floor plan option.  
 LNNFPST  Floor plan status.

LNTotPmtAmt.description: Amount of total payment, not including buydowns, for this schedule.  The amount is optional for interest-only schedules but is required for the remaining schedule types.  For Loan Category P, the initiating institution's P&I.

LNPmtPlnNbr.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans, identifies the payment plan used to calculate the payment, as defined on Payment Plan Segment 420 of Bank Control.

LNIntNxtBillDte.description: If an interest-only or maturity payment schedule (Payment Type Zero), date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNEditOnly.description: A 'Y' in this field will cause the host system to perform the necessary edits on requested changes without actually making the changes.

LNNewEffDte.description: New effective date of the payment schedule.  Identifies the date of the first payment in the schedule.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNOldPmtFreq.description:
Old payment frequency.  Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular (creates a bill effective date shown on the payment schedule but will not roll the next bill date forward).

LNNbrOfPayments.description: Number of payments.  The number of bills produced in a past schedule, or the number of bills to be produced in a current or future schedule.

LNPmtFreq.description:
Indicates the frequency of scheduled payments.  
 1  Monthly.  
 2  Quarterly.  
 3  Semiannually.  
 4  Annually.  
 5  At maturity.  
 6  Biweekly.  
 9  Irregular (creates a bill effective date shown on the payment schedule but will not roll the next bill date forward).

LNPmtSchedTyp.description:
Payment schedule type.  
 I  Interest (Payment Type 0).  
 T  Total (Payment Type other than 0).

LNPmtTyp.description: Payment type.  Determines the billing method for the loan.  Possible values are 0, A, B, C, D, E, F, G, J, and P.  See Loans Reference Volume 2 for details of the different payment types.

LNPIAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans only, the fixed principal and interest portion of the payment. For Loan Category P, the initiating institutions P&I.

LNSrc.description: Identifies the input source of the transaction.

ChrgDdaNbr.description: Identifies the DDA or savings account to which a bill is charged.

LNPmtPct.description: Percent of payment defined and used by Payment Types D, E, F, G, and P.  Any value between 000.00 and 100.00 is valid.  If Payment Type P, a value in this field overrides the value defined on Bank Control Payment Plan Segment 420.

LNEscrAmt.description: Escrow amount included in the total payment.

LNBusDay.description: For revolving credit (Category R) loans, number representing the nth business day of the month on which the Revolving Credit Statement is produced.  Valid values are 1 through 18.  If this field is blank, statements are produced on the monthly anniversary date of the payment schedule effective date.

LNBuydwnAmt.description: For Bill Type A loans only, portion of the payment supplied by someone other than a borrower.

LNMinPmtAmt.description: Minimum payment amount defined and used by Payment Types D, E, F, G, and P.  Field is expressed in whole dollars with a maximum amount of 99999.  If Payment Type P, a value in this field overrides the value defined on Bank Control Payment Plan Segment 420.

LNTotNxtBillDte.description: If not an interest-only or maturity payment schedule, date of the next bill segment.  Format:  CCYY-MM-DD.

LNChrgInd.description:
For automatic bill payments, indicates the type of account to which a bill is charged.  
 A  Automated Funds Transfer System.  
 D  DDA.  
 S   Savings.

MoreInd.description: A 'Y' in this field indicates there are more fees to be returned.

StrtPlnNbr.description: Starting plan number.  For the initial request, this value is not required.  For requests to retrieve additional fees, this value is required.  This value will be returned to indicate the starting point of the next inquiry.
